Reviews.Title: “Hotel rey juan carlos”
Reviews.Author: Dan2084
Reviews.Content: my first impression of the hotel was not a good one as the first thing person encountered was a porter swinging what looked like a bat at a traffic cone. The room was nice although the bed was alittle small. The breakfast was not great and was very greasy. drinks in the hotel were very over priced as a bottle of water and a glass of orange juice came to nearly 13 euros. i was also not aware that the hotel swimming pools would be closed and this was not mentioned anywhere when i booked the hotel however the spa does have a pool which will cost you 20 euros each to use. the spa facilites are same sex only which is a massive let down if you are traveling as a couple for a romantic get away. i was far from impressed with this hotel and i would not go back to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Beautful and Quiet Getaway”
Reviews.Author: Connie525
Reviews.Content: We were fortunate to be placed at this hotle by our cruise line. We arrived in Barcelona at 7:00 a.m.and were shuttled to the hotel. Check-in was 3:00 p.m., but we were in our room by 9:00 a.m. We walked in the beautful morning air the 1/2 mile or so to the on off bus stop ( buy your ticket at the hotel to save money!) and began seeing barcelona. We suggest you eat your meal in the city center or on Las Ramblas as the food at the hotel was good, but pricey! The room was comfortable and the staff very accomodating. Our room came with the breakfast brunch which was excellent. Would I stay there again, you bet!

Reviews.Title: “Definitely not a 5 Star hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Zoulfakar K
Reviews.Content: I have been there with my wife for vacation. Theh metro location is 10 minutes walk from hotel, after that around 15 minutes from Catalunya Square (City center) by metro. The bed is very small for a couple! Breakfast variety is average , no boiler at room. I've asked for smoking room during reservation but once I reached they apologized saying it can be ok in a room with two different beds! Good thing about it is cleanliness of room, big bath room.

Reviews.Title: “Get a good room rate and walk to the footy”
Reviews.Author: LesErbCharlie
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Rey may times on business, and as it was walking distance to the Nou Camp, my wife daughter and I stayed here knowing that it would be expensive. The room was OK, though worn, it was a large double with room for a camp bed. A bottle of water was 5 Euros in the bedroom. As we arrived late we had dinner at the hotel, the staff were very concnerned to make sure they got stuff right for our daughter's allergies and were friednly and kind. Especially since we were Barca fans. The Bill for three ways around 100 Euros. It is 15 mins into the centre of town by tube. Overall, we got what we expected, a business hotel were everything above the good deal on the room was very expensive.

Reviews.Title: “A fabulous experience, 10 minutes from the Nou Camp!”
Reviews.Author: TheBroons2012
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed for 2 nights on our recent honeymoon. We had a fabulous 5 star experience, it was well placed at the end of one of the Metro lines, right by the University, a very safe feeling location. Only 10 minutes from the Nou Camp and the hotel staff were all helpful and friendly. Highly recommended if you are a looking for a treat! The hotel lobby is a truely awesome spectacle.

Reviews.Title: “You will be ripped off on the 30 euro parking”
Reviews.Author: Tubtruck
Reviews.Content: Stayed last night at this hotel, looks good from the outset,though the rooms are a looking bit tatty around the edges. The bath taps were not woking in our room either. Stay clear of the mini bar unless you feel 11 euros + taxes is good value for a single measure of sprits. Evrything else in the hotel is designed to screw as much money out of you as possible, 36 euros for breakfast, I think not. Noise in the hotel was terrible, a dog was outside and spent 1 hour between 4 and 5 am barking and nothing seemed to be done The worst and biggest rip off is the parking, no other parking is available in the area so the hotel takes advantage and charges an eye watering 30 euros per night for the privilege. I mentioned this to the concierge and he seemed to find it amusing that a guest found that simply throwing money at the hotel for any tiny service is not the norm. I would advise anyone to stay well clear of this establishment.

Reviews.Title: “Business hotel”
Reviews.Author: CultureVultureCamb
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a two day business conference. Impressive lobby area and comfortable rooms. I slept well in a large bed and the bathroom was well appointed. Yet the carpet was threadbare in places and the wardrobe in the lobby area had been damaged by hitting the inner door (when this was closed the bedroom was very quiet). The hotel is surrounded by lovely gardens and we had our lunches served from a garden room with access to outside area which was great after being stuck in airless, windowless rooms for our meeting. You could also walk in the gardens which makes a change from the typical airport style business hotel. The gardens make this a good place to stay. The hotel has plenty of seminar rooms which are ideal for a business conference. As others have remarked it is a long way from the city centre so not a good choice for a tourist, there are bus stops nearby and the hotel has its own taxi rank. The Univeristy district is nearby and we wandered out and found a corner bar where our group had eight beers for about 15 euros, approx the cost of two beers in the hotel bar. The hotel is definitely priced for expense accounts! Spain is not well known for its vegetarian food but this is a hotel offering conferences to international audiences and we were asked in advance about dietary requirements. For our conference dinner the meal was tasty and imaginative but for the buffets we had the rest of the time the choice was terrible. The first evening the veggie food was grilled vegatables and bread. This was against a vast selection for meat eaters. The lunches improved slightly over this and at least most things were labelled. The service can best be described as prompt! The staff are constantly clearing plates away. There were a few staff who looked pleased to serve but most looked bored and too tied up with their own rules, they refused to let one of our number play the piano and told people off for sitting in the wrong place in the lobby. Overall though, it was a cut above the usual conference venue and for a business meeting it is worth considering.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel but bring your own iron!”
Reviews.Author: Mummydolphin
Reviews.Content: Nice business hotel. Free wireless which worked okay. Near the metro which was handy for transport, also lots of taxis at front of hotel. Shower small, separate bath tub was very good. The only issue I had was that they could not supply an ironing board and iron to my room, the only option was to send ironing to their in-house laundry service $$. I cannot think of the last time I stayed in a hotel where they did not supply an in room iron!

Reviews.Title: “why you should stay in here?”
Reviews.Author: cnkyldrm
Reviews.Content: as a business hotel, it makes sense to stay in this impressive building. it is very close to metro station and to diagonal boulevard. workers are very helpful and friendly (as all over Barcelona, i do like people of Barcelona) breakfast is good (might be better, yet, the service is so good that you feel good :)) shower in the bathroom need to be fixed, remote control of tv was running out of batteries and safe was locked, apart these inconveniences, sleep quality is good and no any noise from windows. for holidays, i wouldn't prefer the location.

Reviews.Title: “Good upmarket Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Benny1965
Reviews.Content: This Is really a wonderful hotel close to the subway and with access to all attractions. Wonderful view from the room. We had a Corporate rate, so it was really great value for the price. The Garden is wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Looks not matched by service”
Reviews.Author: Scottaly
Reviews.Content: The Rey Juan Carlos has the dressings of the five star hotel it should be, but the out of the way location and seriously unfriendly service are like a big dollop of ketchup on your best silk tie. There's plenty of good: The rooms are appealing, clean and pretty spacious. The fitness center is decently equipped. The breakfast is impressive. And yet if the staff ( especially at the brakfast and bar) look like they would be anywhere else can be positively unfriendly. If you aim to be 5 star your service should be too.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: nikkig257
Reviews.Content: Amazing hotel, beautiful entrance and lobby. Delicious breakfast, huge selection. Big room an bathroom with both a bath and shower. The bed was large but hard - as in most European hotels. No kettle provided in the rooms, but I'm sure they would happily provide hot water if requested. Most helpful staff, and very welcoming. Lovely outlook over garden and pool and very close to barcalona FC stadium and metro station. Overall, great pick!

Reviews.Title: “Really impressive”
Reviews.Author: HelenBlyth
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a bit of a way from the real centre of Barcelona, so be prepared to build in the cost of transport. Taxi to the centre is about 16 Euros. The hotel is superior in every way, the reception area is huge and the staff attentive. My room was on the 2nd floor and was very well appointed. I wish i had a bathroom at home like this one. There are bathrobes, full size bath sheets and every type of accessory you could require. The room was very light and airy with a view of the Football stadium, you can hear the crowd if you open the window!! On leaving the concierge offered us the hotel car to take us the the airport, for the same price as a taxi so this was an unexpected pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Good for business”
Reviews.Author: BigBumpaGirl
Reviews.Content: Only stayed for the one night on a business trip and I was very impressed with the hotel. The staff were very friendly and helpful and the rooms were a very good size. Free wifi throughout the hotel was a bonus. The food was ok, not anything special but reasonably priced.

Reviews.Title: “Business trip”
Reviews.Author: CameronsFaePerth
Reviews.Content: An excellent hotel to stay for a business trip. Even if it is frequented by the footballers visiting to play against the local team. Service is friendly and efficient. The rooms are excellent. The public areas are possibly a bit too public, so you need to go to one of the bars or business centre if you want more privacy. Not much around the hotel itself, but it's only a taxi trip into town. Well positioned between the aiort and town, so access is very good. It's a big conference venue, so often busy with delegates and is therefore quite lively.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Poor Location”
Reviews.Author: Stephen J
Reviews.Content: Great rooms, bars and restaurants. Very professional staff. Secure parking - (was provided by a member of Bell Staff watching the car throughout their night shift. Thats service ! :-) Terrible location, appears to be a 'Red Light' area...

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, bad service”
Reviews.Author: Mellander
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel in September. Was completely satisfied with everything (room/food/pool etc.) until it was time for checkout, which I did early in the morning to catch my morning flight. I then found out that I had been charged 200 euros more than what my booking said (stayed five nights). The man in the reception said he couldn't change my bill but that he would talk to his boss and that I could leave my credit card number. A couple of weeks later I noticed that my credit card had been charged with exactly the same amount including the 200 extra (I didn't even get an invoice/receipt). When I sent the hotel an email about it including a copy of my initial booking fee I got a receipt back--STILL with the 200 extra! I sent another email back but never heard from them again. So, since I didn't have the time/effort to pursue this I ended up paying 40 euros extra per night!

Reviews.Title: “horrible service, very impersonal hotel, highly disappointed!”
Reviews.Author: Eelonora G
Reviews.Content: I was staying here last September for a business trip of a week: luckily I wasn’t paying because it’s a rip off considering the (no)service they give! They refused to give us an iron in the room because they wanted to (over)charge for laundry-service and the staff at the reception is quite rude. There is definitely no value for money! I have stayed in other 4-5 stars hotel and really don’t understand what’s the big fuss about this one: I will not recommend it to anyone! Only positive note is the swimming pool.

Reviews.Title: “Good business hotel - well outside city center”
Reviews.Author: compassjohn
Reviews.Content: Was there for a conference. The facility and staff were great, however I would have preferred to be downtown. That is the reason for a lower rating. This was a good 20 min ride from the city. There was also very little around - very limited outside restaurants (there was however a tavern nearby that was nice). Other than that, always had to jump in a cab or use the nearby tram/metro.

Reviews.Title: “Good service , relax hotel”
Reviews.Author: Azor68
Reviews.Content: I have been a business meeting . I think very good hotel. I stayed suit room . Very comfortable room. Wonderful bathroom . Clean room and helpful staff .I like breakfast menu .

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - location ok”
Reviews.Author: panerai104
Reviews.Content: This hotel deserves 4 1/2 stars in my book, I think the only detractor is the location. It really depends what you're after. It does take a little bit of effort to get to the downtown area. The Metro is a 4-5 min. walk, and it will take you pretty much anywhere, anytime. We were there for a Barca FC game, and the location is perfect for getting to the game. In short: -The Room: 15th floor Superior room, very nice, firm bed, clean, great view. -The fitness center: free, clean, lots of equipment, new, almost no people. -The Polo Restaurant: went there for buffet lunch and a la carte dinner, excellent service, very good food, great wines. -Aris Scotch Bar: fun, friendly, good selection of beverages and cigars. All in all an ecellent place to stay in Barcelona, but next time we will stay closer to the "action" so to speak, but we won't expect the same kind of amenities for the same price.

Reviews.Title: “Georgous Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Karen B
Reviews.Content: If you are in Barcelona this is a hotel you MUST stay at. From the moment of our arrival we were in Awe. This Hotel from the outside to the lobby and to our room was breath taking. We took a walk outside to the garden and walked around and were so pleased. The staff was very helpful. The next day we had a breakfast buffet, the food was delicious. I am a very picky person when I travel, I demand comfort, clean and fairly modern hotel rooms. This hotel met and exceeded my expectations. I give this 5 stars hands down.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent services 4 1/2 stars, room 3 1/2 if you travel from NA”
Reviews.Author: Loana2005
Reviews.Content: I traveled on business, it was a pleasant stay, the room was ready before noon, the receptionist offered a voucher for a drink at the bar, staff very very friendly and helpful, excellent room service, good food, but the Hotel is not 5 stars. The room, for a NA Traveler, is 3 1/2 stars at most. The furniture is fairly old, and the look not so modern. For the drapes and the feature pillows, the material seemed quite old and not that clean. The pool had several tiles chipped (i actually took a few pics) and mosaic pieces on the walls missing. A nice feature of the hotel is the garden where you can walk a bit and relax right before going to bed. Location wise, the hotel is fairly far away from the downtown area. If you are just in and out, it might be okay, but if you have some time in the afternoons to browse the city, you will have to take a cab (10-15 min).

Reviews.Title: “Avoid if possible”
Reviews.Author: PaddyIrish186605
Reviews.Content: We had a dreadful experience in this hotel recently. They must go out of their way to train their staff to be rude and unaccomodating! We were staying as part of of a team competing at an international horse show. At the end of the jumping we tried to get food, and were told no, not even sandwiches! We could split up our party and go and get room service,which we had to do. The room service delivery was incomplete,and when we rang to have it corrected, the waiter just smirked. No free wifi, or parking, even for residents, extremely unhelpful about local directions, ran out of English newspapers VERY early in the morning, basic spa facilities were charged for (even just a sauna - in a so called 5 star!), pool closed although 29 degrees outside , All in all a horrible experience,and when I said this on checking out,they were not even interested in the why!! NEVER be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great service in an imposing 5* hotel”
Reviews.Author: K15hy
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a conference at this hotel and I found everything to be very nice indeed. On arrival my room was ready (a bonus as this was only 11am) and the service was pleasant and efficient. My room itself was very nice indeed, large, spotlessly clean with a nice view - my only slight gripe with the room was that you can't turn the shower on until you are in it or you get the floor very wet, otherwise very nice. The conferece facilities were excellent, the breakout areas were large and plentifull, and the wireless was very reliable through the whole 36 hours I was there. Overall a very good hotel for business, the only point I would make is that it is some distance from town and even at 9pm the transfer time was 20+ mins so I wouldn't recommend it for visitors wanting to be located close to the action.

Reviews.Title: “Everything you'd expect from a 5-star international hotel”
Reviews.Author: SCT55
Reviews.Content: The imposing but not particularly attractive exterior hides an impressive lobby/atrium. Room excellent, spacious and well equipped. First class aircon and great views - even from the third floor. Free, hassle-free wifi connection. Service prompt, efficient and unobtrusive - just as it should be. Food generally very good - regretably I didn't get chance to eat dinner there, though breakfast not as lavish as some hotels of this calibre. Cozy bar. The grounds look great but didn't have an opportunity to explore/enjoy them - ditto the fitness centre. Only 15 minutes taxi ride to the airport but nearer 30 minutes to downtown so not the best location for exploring on foot. I was told it's considered by locals to be the best hotel in the city, though I have no recent experiences to compare/confirm that view.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a quiet area, 250m from metro station”
Reviews.Author: Deunds
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel situated in a quiet area, near one of main streets in Barcelona (Av. Diagonal). NouCamp, the biggest soccer stadium, is just 20 mins of walk away.

Reviews.Title: “Not Bad But Not Great”
Reviews.Author: billyboy18
Reviews.Content: Well, you are not really in Barcelona but I guess you know that. I was attending a Conference and the Hotel has a big conference center adjacent to it so there I was. Check in was quick and my room was ready at 8 am whihc was a real plus. The room was large enough but the lighting was strange and not easy to figure out when you are jet lagged. The bathroom was ok but if you waiting outside the shower for the water to get hot it ended up all over the floor. The TV was broken but I didn't care or report it. The restaurant was good, the gardens were nice as was the pool. The staff was fine and fairly friendly. So not terrible. Takes a while to get into town especially when there is traffice whihc seemed to be all the time.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel. nice staff!”
Reviews.Author: Saurabhkedia
Reviews.Content: Very helpful staff, although english language & vegeterian food was a problem. But the staff tried their best to resolve these issues to best of their abilities. We did not face that much problem as we were there for a conference, and had our own helpdesk. arranging a blackberry charger in spite of it not being available in the hotel a very thoughtful touch. was delighted by the same.

Reviews.Title: “Stunning hotel with great views and run as cash-cow”
Reviews.Author: MrsPiket
Reviews.Content: A long way from the city centre, the hotel is 15 minutes by taxi from BCN terminals and has the Catalunya congress centre at its doorstep. A walk to the metro station takes 6 minutes. The Cervantes park is nearby. The hotel has an impressive vertiginous patio and beautiful gardens. Overloaded with staffs who provide the services of a huge sleeping factory. The buffet breakfast is good with ample variety and good coffee from a Nespresso machine. No personal attention, no eggs made to order. We had a 25m2 room, adequately furnished and decorated, with reasonable yet hard beds. The hotel is 12 storey building in V-shape and from the room we had a great view. A small side window can be opened. Bathroom is OK with quality amenities, bathrobe and slippers, a large bathtub, a separate shower and a separate toilet and bidet. Both room and bathroom were clean. The room had no coffee & tea making facilities nor ironing board. The gym is spacious and well equipped. The wellness area includes dress rooms with lockers, showers, several saunas, steam bath, cold baths and indoor pool. All is clean. Wellness and gym are nice but you have to pay extra. For a hotel of this standard a spa that is not complementary for guests is a chutzpah. The 20m outdoor pool is at no extra charge. Basically, this hotel caters to weddings and guests who are here for a conference. If you like being close to your conference and you don't care about being overcharged for every basic need, please book. If you care about value for money: find yourself another hotel. For its attempts to be a ‘Leading Hotel of the World’ the hotel fails. Note that all extra’s: wellness, internet, food, drinks, coffees, etc are totally overpriced.

Reviews.Title: “Crappy internet, great views, good location.”
Reviews.Author: stubby_galavant
Reviews.Content: It was a serious hassle to get internet here. Given the expense of the hotel, both in the room cost and building the huge thing, you would think this would be trivial. The days where I could get signal, half the time the network speed was glacial. This seems to be a very common problem across Europe: that, or you have to pay a fortune for a connection. On the positive side, the interior of the hotel is stunning, as are the pool and the gardens. The staff were friendly and multi-lingual for the most part.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for family holiday”
Reviews.Author: PYPF
Reviews.Content: What we liked about the hotel: Pools and kids playground, our toddler loved the glass elevators and looking down on the "mushroom lights" in the lobby Fantastic breakfast -the hours are great for those who doesn't want to get up early just to eat Nice clean rooms Granite bathroom with bath(!) Friendly and courteous staff It's away from the the buzy areas Metro is close by (about 5 min walk) Taxi fares are not too expensive (9-12 euros for most of our trips) Things we didn't mind so much but may bother others: There's not much around the hotel to explore We did see a couple "ladies of the night" in the neighborhood when we returned past 12 one evening. They were not right close to the hotel though.

Reviews.Title: “We had an absolutely great time and we'll definately come back!”
Reviews.Author: Camilla B
Reviews.Content: This hotel can offer everything for everyone! The Superior room was of very great standard. Breakfast was lovely. The Metro station just around the corner for easy access to downtown. Walking distance to Camp Neu Arena! Pool areas were great, suitable both for familys as well as for couples and singles. Great service from all departments! We'll definately come back and then bring our daughters as well.

Reviews.Title: “Modern hotel, impressive style”
Reviews.Author: PSL3000
Reviews.Content: I only spent one night in this hotel, but I got a lasting impression from the style it is built: a huge atrium surrounded by the several floors. It is a modern hotel, with all necessary amenities. The rooms was very clean, everyone very helpful. Breakfast was "okay", without being overwhelming.

Reviews.Title: “Much expected, little delivered”
Reviews.Author: golfingaround
Reviews.Content: Should be a classy hotel, but disappointing. Not a real big room, but what was unacceptable: no internet or sometimes very very slow... unbelievable!

Reviews.Title: “Old and Far from City Center”
Reviews.Author: htembe
Reviews.Content: We stayed as a couple at this hotel for 3 days during our visit to Barcelona. The location is poor, far from everything, except the Camp Nou (Barcelona stadium) which is a 10 minute walk from the Hotel. The furniture in the rooms are OLD, the TV is the first generation of flat screens that came out some 7 years ago. Breakfast is not all that, very disorganized compared to other hotels. We had dinner at the restaurant by the pool and it was good. If you like football (Soccer) and you happen to be in Barcelona during the season i recommend it for its location. Otherwise stay away from it, there are better options.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: IqbalNoor
Reviews.Content: Rey Juan Carlos is an excellent hotel. Very upscale, high quality. Excellent service staff, great food and even the location is very very nice. Our room overlooked the polo ground and swimming pool. The hotel has two pools and great garden - called Gardens! The lobby is truly large but a bit quiet. The walk to metro, bus and tram stops is about 5 minutes and the mtro takes you to Rambla in about 20 minutes. This is the green line so pretty much everything there is to see is on it! The downside - if you must - is that there is no tea/coffee making facilities in the room and no, they will not provide you an iron/ironing board. The room service is quite reasonably priced but the laundry is exhorbitant. We will be very happy to go back to this hotel if we are ever in Barcelona again!

Reviews.Title: “Very expensive and not in a great location”
Reviews.Author: blondeylocks
Reviews.Content: There is no arguing that it is the best location for attending conferences in the adjoining convention centre but apart from that I found the rooms to be "standard" considering the price paid! The location is well out of the city centre, at least 15-20 mins in a taxi. WOuld not be my first choice of hotel in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Old and tired, Away from tourist area”
Reviews.Author: Annonymous56
Reviews.Content: Old and tired hotel. Location is not good either, far away from everything!! Service was nice though. Lobby may be appealing but rooms are below average. This hotel needs renovation!

Reviews.Title: “Great breakfast and modern hotel, very good base”
Reviews.Author: kimmok88
Reviews.Content: This hotel is rated 5* and although it does not meet up to Asian standards (I'm not sure any European ones ever will!) it is a good hotel. The hotel is a bit further out from the centre but it's not a problem as the metro is 3 mins away and very easy to use. We got a deal for the hotel so it was EUR 145 per night which is cheaper than centre hotels which are not as nice. You can get a metro ticket with 10 trips for EUR 8.25 to use over the holiday. First impressions are great, when you come in it's a large open space area with really nice decoration and piano player in the centre where the cafe/bar is. Reception service was good although we had to wait 2 hours for one of the rooms to be ready which wasn't so good... The rooms are quite nice, the curtains and bedding could do with an updated pattern or none at all but overall it's nice. The bathroom is clean and has a separate bath and shower. Breakfast is very good at the hotel. There's hot food served (you can still get your fry up!) and you can order eggs and omelettes to your preference. There's plenty of fruit, yoghurt, cereal, breads, meat and cheese so it suits all countries. Best of all you can have champagne with your breakfast although you have to keep an eye out for the waiter bringing a new bottle to the buffet as it goes quick. You won't have to eat any lunch as you'll be so full! Overall it's a great hotel, not sure if I would pay full price but the breakfast is definitely worth it!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for access to conference centre and airport”
Reviews.Author: Kes58
Reviews.Content: My husband and I travelled from Australia having initially stayed two nights in Rome, then four nights in Positano. Following that, we stayed for five nights at the Hotel Carlos Rey Juan, Barcelona, primarily for a conference that my husband was attending at the adjacent conference centre. We had never been to Barcelona before and I would love to return! I was not attending the conference, so I planned to do some swimming, shopping and sightseeing, I also planned to accompany my husband to a conference cocktail reception and a Presidents Dinner. We had booked a quiet, junior suite as we were aware that they were located on the higher floors and we required peace and space for my husband to sit and write a paper after his presentation at the conference. We were not disappointed. Our enormous junior suite rooms on the 15th floor, were positioned away from the hotel's atrium which was on the odd occasion, quite noisy, due to wedding celebrations and other activity, such as piano playing and large groups congregating together. In the room, there was so much natural light and we were facing the mountains. I loved the mattress, linen and cleanliness of the rooms, although the window furnishings were run down, and they didn't seem to have efficient block out lining. The air conditioning was good and nice and quiet. My husband enjoyed the connectivity to the free high speed internet.There was also a kettle in the suite that we really appreciated. (We had to order a jug of milk for the room as the powdered creamer was not what we liked, and on one occasion this cost us 5 Euros.) Some of the upholstered chairs in the room were uncomfortable and maybe had lost their spring and needed reupholstering. The tap water in the room was maybe heavily chlorinated, it was safe to drink but it tasted disgusting. In the end my husband bought some bottled water at the supermarket so we could enjoy it and also we used it in our coffees and teas. It was very hot weather, and we are also swimmers. We were anticipating many swims in their gorgeous garden pool. We only had two opportunities to do this, because unfortunately, we were to learn that often that area was closed to guests so that the staff could set up for weddings and other such functions, and on a couple of frustrating encounters, we were diverted to the then crowded fitness pool and we were somewhat inconvenienced and disappointed by this. The conference breakfast room was on the mezzanine level for the first couple of mornings, probably because of the wedding and other guests using the better rooms on the ground floor. Even though the food for buffet breakfast was amazing with a vast selection, I thought that the overall experience was diminished by the very ordinary surroundings and large round tables for about 12 people that were mostly empty by the time I was there. As we were time poor and there weren't any restaurants very close by to walk to, we ate in the hotel restaurant for dinner on two occasions - on the night of our arrival and the night before we left. We found the ambience in the hotel restaurant quite nice, the staff were attentive and the food and wine was pretty good and well priced. As we had come directly from Italy, we noticed that in Barcelona, the understanding of the English and the language was not as good as in our previous hotel. We went to the concierge in the late afternoon of the day of our arrival. Concierge didn't seem to understand that as we had been travelling all day (and that my husband had to get up at 7am the next day), all we wanted to was eat dinner at 6pm (not in our room) and then go to bed. The concierge could not direct us to one restaurant close by that was open until at least 8.00pm, we even knew that this was the norm for Spain, but with such a large hotel and guests coming in from all over the world, we were hoping that there was at least something close by! The next night I was sure the concierge had booked us into a restaurant close by, so we took an hours walk there only to find it closed. Thankfully, the helpful, friendly taxi driver found us wondering around and offered to take us elsewhere and we had a great meal at a place that he found for us. When I asked the concierge the next day about the closed restaurant, he knew nothing about that restaurant booking for us, only something about another restaurant booking we had made for another night, which we ended up having to cancel, which was also a difficult encounter. Aside from that, the concierge were good at recommending an all day bus tour, and providing details about catching the efficient Metro with maps provided and the station close by. In summary, the hotel position was perfect for its spaciousness, cleanliness and proximity to the conference centre and airport. The buffet breakfast food was amazing, and overall the staff were friendly and mostly helpful. Even though the metro was very nearby, if we were to visit Barcelona again as tourists only, I would personally prefer to stay more central so that other dining, shopping, and swimming options were available nearby.

Reviews.Title: “We loved and we'll be back”
Reviews.Author: rishikothari
Reviews.Content: Rishi:Rishi Kothari "Abundance everywhere" Date:1st June 2011 We booked this hotel after checking the reveiws from Tripadvisor.Its an awesome property. We stayed at third floor of the 14 storey hotel.It had nice big rooms with lovely view of Barcelona club.Staff was really helpful.Food was great specially the breakfast.It's very close to universitat metro station hence travelling across the city was very easy.Its conference hall is one of the biggest in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Catalan Hospitality”
Reviews.Author: cthompson65
Reviews.Content: The overall impression of the hotel is good. Its a business hotel focused in congress and seminars as it is located nearby the airport but far from the city. The breakfast is great actually one of the best I ever seen.

Reviews.Title: “Just Right”
Reviews.Author: travelmom2006
Reviews.Content: I went to Barcelona for a meeting, that was held in another hotel,I travelled alone, stayed for 2 nights. The room was great, big, spacious, great amenities in the room. Bathroom was great also, bed very comfortable. Wi-fi worked properly - it was free - ! Staff was very nice and the breakfast had great variety! There was nothing missing! Location : Far from the centre, but near the subway that takes you in 20 mn to the Ramblas. Amazing Garden in front of the hotel, great areas around the hotel, swimming pools and fitness room. I wish I could have stayed more to enjoy all these pleasant areas!... maybe next time...

Reviews.Title: “Nice but not stellar.”
Reviews.Author: Dukesteer
Reviews.Content: We visited in March. Without hesitation I would recommend this hotel. However, it had the feeling of being just a bit rundown. Even so, the location is good and the staff excellent. We were treated like royalty in the restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Not a 5*GL”
Reviews.Author: Kolia
Reviews.Content: The hotel was build in 1992 but as per the architecture seems to be of the seventies. Possibly at the opening it was a 5* GL, but definetely not now. The hotel is located in a quite and nice area but quite far from everything. There was a queue at the reception desk, with only one receptionist attending the arriving guests. There were more staff in the back office, but it seemed that noone was bothered about the queue. For some reasons I have stayed in a 4* hotel in Barcelona the previous night, there was no queue and 2 receptionist. I understand that there might be a queue in any hotel, but on my opinion a 5*GL can not afford the luxury of having only one receptionist with a queue of guests. The room was spacious and comfortable. The furniture looks new. The mattress was quite hard for me, but this depends on the personal taste. I have asked for a non smoking room but the room I was given was smelling tobacco smoke. The design of the room is a bit strange in some details. There is a hall at the entrance to the room with the minibar and wardrobe. The entrance to the bathroom is from the entrance hall. The bathroom is big, well iluminated and spacious, exactly as 5*GL bathroom should be. The minibar is located in one of the wardrobes at the entrance meanwhile the safety box is located in the room, under the desk with the TV, where in any "normal" hotel the minibar would be. The entrance to the room from the entrance hall is separated by a door. The door to the room opens to the wrong side. Let me explain. The shelf for the luggage is located inside the room just behind the door. So everytime you want to take your clothes from your luggage to the wardrobe in the hall - you need to take your clothes out of your luggage first, then pass to the entrance hall, close the room door, then open the wardrobe and hang the clothes in. Repeat the operation depending on the quantity of clothes you have. After 4-5 "tours" I have left the remaining clothes in my luggage until next "hanging session". Can't say anything about the amenities of the hotel, but have seen people playing tennis, advertising in the elevators about spa, gym, massage, etc. The breakfast was just correct. For a 5*GL could be a lot better and with more choice. The bars are extremely expensive, I mean the minibar and lobby bar. One 0,33l bottle of Heineken in the lobby bar costs about 8 eur. You can check the minibar prices on the photo attached. The prices are without VAT, actually at 18%. If you want to have a quite stay and use the amenities this hotel might be for you. If you want to visit Barcelona as a tourist, there are better and less expensive options available in the city without giving up the quality. I would rank the hotel like this: 5*GL for the overall space and bathroom, 4-5* for the room, 3* for the reception, service and staff. The bar and minibar prices are out of the market.

Reviews.Title: “Skip this one”
Reviews.Author: BriefBoy
Reviews.Content: They can't keep the water and electricity on, and they don't care. The AC blows directly on you when in bed, and is very noisy. They will try and jerk you on the rate, so have your confirmation! Most importantly it is a horrible location 30 minutes out, with hookers on Avinguda de L'Exercit. Even they cab drivers say "bad area"

Reviews.Title: “wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: ravi_s13
Reviews.Content: excellent hotel to stay, went on a business trip, they have a good conference facilities and food was good. Lot of variety and staff was exceptionally good. Wonderful rooms, spacious and good views. stay was fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Not Five Star”
Reviews.Author: YorkshireCelticTiger
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel as it is right beside an international conference centre. I booked in for 3 nights. It's easily accessable by taxi from the airport (20mins/€20). It's a beautiful building and appointed to 5 star standard, unfortunately that's the best I have to say. At this time of the year there is one a la carte restaurant with a limited menu, a bar (which doesn't serve pints) and a central area which shares it's food menu with the bar. I found the food to be basic and over priced. Besides the bar, the service left me cold. My mini bar was warm and was not fixed after having reported the problem on my first morning. I had one 200ml cola for €5 and didn't really feel the urge to sample anything else at that price. I walked down the street towards town and found a shop after 20mins. Here I got 1.5L of Coke, 2 bags of nuts and some mints for €5. I kept the cola in the ample safe which was cooler than the minibar for the duration of my stay. The Camp Nou is a comfortable 20min walk and well worth a visit (€19). I reported the air conditioning not to be adjustable at the same time as the minibar problem but this wasn't fixed either. I left it turned off and found the temperature to be better this way. The free wifi worked very well in the room but not in the bar. The outdoor swimming pool was closed and I think there was a charge for the indoor one although I could be wrong about this. On the plus side, they printed my boarding pass for free and the hotel car to the airport was just €5 dearer than a taxi and very comfortable. If I were coming to this conference centre, I would try another hotel a bit closer to the centre and walk back up the street which is in a pleasant university area.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice, Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: BeHappy001
Reviews.Content: Its a beautiful hotel. Amazing ambience and lobby, which will definitely impress you as you enter. Rooms are spacious and bright and very neat. Hotel is close to airport, but away from city so may have to travel if you wish to be in city centre for shopping or for restaurants, but subway is just walking distance. I was there for a conference which was organised in same compound, so location did not matter much. Best setup for company meetings, conference, convention, events etc... Overall an amzing exprience and really impressed. But failed in keeping few must required aminities in the room, like iron, coffee and tea etc..

Reviews.Title: “Astonishing prices”
Reviews.Author: KRC2006
Reviews.Content: This hotel has decided that business people are on expenses so they can charge what they like. 6,50euros for a small cappuchino in the groundfloor lounge, and 40euros for a club sandwich and a drink in the evening. It´s a conference hotel, Hyatt-like in its atrium. I suppose that view has to be paid for. Great jewelry shop, with Hermes, Chaumet, Mikimoto brands represented. If people can afford those cappuchinos, then they must be able to afford this store. Don´t stay here unless your conference is here, and then make sure that your attendess are not subject to the groundfloor cafe prices. Easy cab ride from Barcelona airport.

Reviews.Title: “Business focused - great service, but try not to drink/eat anything there!”
Reviews.Author: Juanex
Reviews.Content: The location is fine, everything is near, but not close by. You can actually use the Metro or Tranvia (which are less than two blocks away), just take a cab in the front door or walk if you are willing to walk for 20 mins or so. Installations and Service wise, the hotel is great, but is 5€ for water or 6€ for a beer and anywhere outside the hotel will be a lot cheaper than that.

Reviews.Title: “Tranquility, great service and lovely food. Must go back”
Reviews.Author: ken9446Edinburgh
Reviews.Content: An unusual and impressive design of hotel just four stops on the metro from the centre. El Corte Ingles is just 15 minutes walk away . The area is mainly University Faculties with lots of students ( all very civilised ) milling around. The breakfast buffet is very impressive, lots of fresh fruit and plenty of choice of cereals, hot food, coffee and different types of bread. My room on the 8th floor overlooked several large outdoor horse riding areas with very high class dressage training going on. Dinner for 30 Euros, which included mineral water and a glass of wine was superb. My room was spacious with a large bathroom, great facilities and totally tranquil. Can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “New Years Eve Party”
Reviews.Author: PhilVon
Reviews.Content: We were looking for somewhere to spend New Years Eve, after a few disappointing previous Eve's we were a little apprehensive. Around 300.00 euros for two, a dinner buffet and party after we decided to give the Rey Juan Carlos 1 a go....... and we had a great evening's entertainment. The staff were professional, polite and friendly, spoke English as well as Spanish/Catalan, were attentive to your needs and never far away. The buffet was a very high standard, hot and cold options, main courses of fish and meets and a great desert experience, as well as constantly being topped up with Champagne, wines etc. The evening started around 20:00 although we arrived later at 22:00, had a pleasant meal in nice dining surroundings before midnight arrived with party hats and balloons and the obligatory 12 grapes. After midnight the festivities moved to a ballroom for a party with a live band, high quality playing a good variety of music, rock, pop, rock and roll, enough for all generations to enjoy, and more drinks, all inclusive. From memory I think we left around 4 in the morning, had a wonderful time and restored our faith in new years eve parties. Would recommend as a great night and good value for good quality dining and a party.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, nice conference center, far from action”
Reviews.Author: molevin
Reviews.Content: It was a pleasure staying here although it is kind of far from the center of things in Barcelona. This is a real problem if you want to be around La Rambla, go to tapas bars or go see lots of modernist architecture (i.e the great things to do in Barcelona). When we arrived (new to Barcelona) at around 9:30 we asked where to go for tapas and the absolutely terrific concierce told us about a fantastic place downtown, got us a cab and told the driver what to do, and we had a memorable evening. The included breakfasts were very good but at other times of the day and eve there was no place to get a snack in the hotel. Weird for a big 5 star hotel. The conference center is super convenient. There is a subway station nearby but since there the pickpockets outnumber the tourists, maybe not the ideal mode of transport.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: Irenee_Shpak
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very good. We stayed on the executive floor, very spacy room. Nice furniture, clean, separate light control. Bath and shower in the bathroom. Big Bathroom. only two min walk froom the metro and one min to the congress center. but it takes 20 min by metro to get to the center, though it's a direct line. The breakfast was very nice, lots of food. There were only two problems. First, smth wrong with an air conditioner, it was too hot in the room, we called guest services several times, they promised to handle it but nothing changed. Secondly, the fitness was extra charge, 16 euros a day. That was the first time i saw this in any hotel of the world. But overall everything very good and by the way free internet excess in the hotel everywhere!!!

Reviews.Title: “perfect business hotel in barca”
Reviews.Author: Vivek_Arora
Reviews.Content: Was staying there for a business conference and the venue could not have been better, Has one of the best infrastructures for business meeting and is visited very frequently by diplomats, bureaucrats, ministers etc. FC Barca stadium is very close. Sad part, quite far from La Ramblas and other happening places but still very well connected by metro. Must stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: helloagainfromasia
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights for business. Staff are kind enough and responsive enough. Foods at breakfast is also good one. Close enough to Metro. Relatively closer to airport... I recommend to stay if you do not want to stay in the city when you come to barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Overvalued hotel - more like a 3.5 stars hotel.”
Reviews.Author: AnilN
Reviews.Content: Imagine a five star rated hotel, and no coffee machine in the room, and no bottles of water provided (normally u r provided with 1 bottle per person in the room per day!). Good reception and their rep come around to expalin the lay-out of the hotel (you are left with a good impression), and then, she say, oh, bye the way, the gym room is extra 16 euros per person per day! - Never heard of this before! From marketing perspwective, all they had to do was include some charge in their room rate and give this service free. Over the five days we stayed, we did not see even a bird enter these facilities. Breakfast is good, but smiles on the waiters would go a long way! Theer is live smusic in the hallway, but my god we could hear the music in our room on the 12th floor, so was the noise level from our neighbours. I have to give a rting of 1 for the noise-level. Having said all this, the rooms are clean and modernized, there is free wirteless internet, good concierge and if you can live with the above inconveniences, the stay was pleasant. I would rate this hotel as more like 3.5 star. Conference room facilities are very good.

Reviews.Title: “The prime example of what a 5 star G.L. hotel should not be”
Reviews.Author: TheProductionHouse
Reviews.Content: Despite having stayed in "this level" of hotel many, many times throughout the world, I have never felt, until today, the need to comment on the quality of an establishment, but my experience in the Rey Juan Carlos has been so disagreeable that I feel that it has to be put into writing, particularly as the hotel are actually requesting reviews by way of a card in my room on the desk in front of me saying "HAPPY STAY? Write your comments on www...... " .. OK. To begin, 10.00 AM, check-in, it takes three trips to and from reception to authorize a key to be able to enter the room. On finally gaining access, immediately the air-conditioning was extremely low (20.5 degrees.) Now I don't like heat, but it was cold. A call to reception, no answer. Another call, no answer. I am now becoming accustomed to the interminable wait for lifts. On a fourth trip to reception, they say they will "mirarlo" (look into it.) 11.30 AM I go to meetings. 17.30 I have to work in the room. . . . It is now 23.00, and I am in a jacket. But I am getting ahead of myself. 21.30, I decide to dine. I investigate the available restaurants, the "a la carte" restaurant is closed on Sundays, so the main restaurant will suffice. They have a menu offering, amongst other dishes, a carbonara to begin with, (way over-done pasta and a sauce with absolutely no taste whatsoever,) a grilled salmon with tomatoes and "alcaparras" (capers), (fish completely overcooked and virtually inedible,) and the "postre" (dessert) a chocolate and orange tart. This was the "icing on the cake" with the decorative chocolate actually glued to the plate! One half fork-full of the tart confirms my suspicions. A slightly redeeming feature was the wine, a Jean Leon Chardonnay. The list continues. I am sure that, in common with 90% of the rest of the clients, I will check-out tomorrow, pay the full invoice despite a feeble attempt at retribution, and "tragar" (swallow) the experience. But hopefully this review will not fall on deaf ears. The decoration is beautiful, but sorry, 5*G.L. requires an attention to detail which here is sadly flawed. Good luck in the future and I am now going to get under the covers and attempt to sleep in a tiny single bed (1 of 2) despite requesting ................ Steve Taylor- THE PRODUCTION HOUSE Madrid and London

Reviews.Title: “This Hotel has certainly got the WOW factor”
Reviews.Author: moraira2
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for a tenth wedding anniversary treat for the two of us and it certainly didn't disappoint. Having read some of the negative reviews we did have some concerns but they were unneccessary. All the staff that we had contact with were friendly and very helpful, the room was immaculate and well maintained by the cleaning staff. We had breakfast in the Polo Restaurant on all four mornings of our stay and the choice and quality was excellent. We also had one evening meal on room service and this was served promptly and with great style by the waiter. The pillows on the beds were not the most comfortable that we have experienced and one night we did have a little problem with TV noise comimg from the adjoining room which went on until 2am. Mini Bar prices were sky high but not a surprise in this type of Hotel. The location was very convenient, only 15 minutes by taxi from the airport (€20), taxi to city centre 5-10 minutes(€10), and only an easy 5 minute walk to Metro station. We didn't have time to use the pools and Spa facilities but were a little surprised to find that they were quite a distance from the main hotel buildings. We were on the 7th floor and our view was inland over the adjoining tennis courts to the hills beyond and was very pleasant. This was our first visit to Barcelona and we intend to return hopefully to the Rey Juan Carlos 1 again!

Reviews.Title: “Never ever again!”
Reviews.Author: agoo
Reviews.Content: Called a 5 star hotel and a member of the "Leading Hotels of the World" but please forget it immediately. If you have seen other hotels of this level (e.g. Dolder in Zurich!), you won't even believe that the Rey Juan Carlos also belongs to it. Extremely ugly from outside, you will find it just horrible inside. Just to give you some examples: - as it was raining, the roof was leaky and the water were collected with several buckets - the windows in the rooms can't be opened and were extremely dirty so that you can't really enjoy the view - even stayed in a suite, the arrangement inside the rooms are somehow awkward as one has first to close an inner door before being able to open a wardrobe - as the breakfast buffett was as small as in a 3 star hotel, the ordered dinner to the room was just unbelievable: instead of a soup of the day, I just got some hot water with a tea spoon of unidentifiable vegetables - uneatable and don't even ask about the price - you wouldn't believe it - spa and wellness area are quite ok (about 4 star) but as it belongs to another company, you have to pay extra for it - personal was not really friendly and unbelievable unflexible - oh, I should also mention that some personal must have stolen my headset of the mobile phone (was inside a bag in my room) - so also put the littlest things in the safe - as my company didn't mention that I came a day later, we also had to pay this night ("we could have sold the room to others") - interestingly, I anyway could not enter the room before 3 p.m. although it should have been empty?! Even trying to be somehow objective, I just can't think of any positive event there. The summary is easy: Never ever again!

Reviews.Title: “Not worth 5 stars”
Reviews.Author: sunshineVienna
Reviews.Content: The huge 15th story hotel has seen better days. I stayed there about 12-14 years ago when it was brandnew. I had a big room but the carpet was terribly worn out. You would not keep such a carpet in your home. Bed was ok and comfortable. The remote control of the flat TV screen did only work occasionaly. Nice bathroom with bathtub and separate shower. Quiet room. The room service menue (breakfast and dinner) was ok, but served without style,e.g. a flower on the trolley. Cleaning staff deserves credit as they were very effective and friendly. The lobby is a place to have a relaxing drink. There is an outdoor swimming pool, a spa and a fitness room, which I didn't use. The hotel is only a few minutes walk to the underground, so it's easy to get around, but not in a central location.

Reviews.Title: “A modern quiet hotel on the outskirts with lots of greenery”
Reviews.Author: stes0609
Reviews.Content: An excellent hotel with spacious, clean room & bathroom (rooms in lots of hotels in Barcelona are very small). We stayed here for a week, Staff were very helpful specially the concierge, we dined at Polo twice, very reasonable & excellent food even for a 5* hotel. The staff were very friendly even in the breakfast room, after a couple of days they knew you & one always had a warm welcome. The breakfast was excellent, one had a huge choice. A short walk to the metro & within 15-20 mins one is at La Ramblas, we had no fears returning to the hotel late.

Reviews.Title: “unfriendly staff”
Reviews.Author: rvalery
Reviews.Content: the hotel itself is very beautiful with nice gardens. however, the service quality is worse than anything i have ever experienced before. the staff was unfriendly and not cooperative. whenever we asked for directions (e.g. to the swimming pool) they pretended not to know or misguided us (pretending there was no swimming pool, when clearly we could see it from our window). at breakfast there were moments when other guests asked for milk and the waitress would tell them if there was no more milk left in the can then that was it (there was still one hour of breakfast time). during our stay of 5 days we experienced several of these moments which made us feel very uneasy.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: melvynrust
Reviews.Content: We chose the hotel mostly because it had a swimming pool and it was only after making the booking that we saw that it had some bad reviews on Trip Advisor so we were a bit anxious about what we would find. But we were pleasantly surprised. We had a large room on the 8th floor with a good view and wonderful bath and shower. We chose to have 2 single beds side by side so lots of room. Do take the breakfast option when booking - it includes as much of everything as you want: cooked (eggs, sausage, bacon, spanish omelette etc), cereals, toast, fresh fruit (eg strawberries, cherries, melon slices, pineapple pieces etc), coffee, tea, juice etc etc. The free swimming pool was very good too - including a shallow pool for young children - towels supplied too. We were worried at first that we were too far out of town - at the end of metro line 3 (Zona Universitaria) but the station was only a 5 min walk away and the train took about 15 mins to reach the centre. By the way the hotel is just off Avenue Diagonal so the address is a bit misleading. Leave the metro at the Avenue Diagonal exit and as you emerge you can see the hotel up to the left, behind the conference centre of Catalunya. The hotel is also on the Tourist Bus route - ask at reception about this - they can sell you a discount pack. The buses were even more frequent than the 'every 10 minutes' that was claimed. We took a 2 day ticket and saw most of the sights that way. Perhaps the only downside for us was that there were no local restaurants for evening meals and the hotel only had one restaurant open from 8.30pm which was quite expensive so we made sure we ate in town before returning to the hotel. Enjoy your trip.

Reviews.Title: “We had a great stay at this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: JillR1111
Reviews.Content: We had a great experience at this hotel. We have traveled extensively in Europe, and for a European hotel, this place was top notch (European hotels are usually extremely tight quarters, standoffish staff, tiny bathrooms with very basic services)! The rooms were a good size, the bathrooms were very clean and lovely with nice toiletries, the outdoor pool was fabulous, especially with young kids as there were different levels of depth that they could play on. Who needs a heated pool in 32 degree celsius weather anyhow?? The service was "European"...might seem cool and distant to non-Europeans, but very knowledgeable and helpful, and spoke very good English along with many other languages. They worked hard to allow our family to check in early as we arrived at 7:30 a.m. A taxi ride anywhere in the city cost around 10 Euros, which is very reasonable and took about 10 minutes. It is also right next door to the Barcelona Football Club, for all you soccer fans. There was also a park with a climber and slide for the kids on the premises. Breakfast was a huge spread of lovely food. All the bad reviews on this site must be from people not used to traveling in Europe... we were scared to go after reading them but can't figure out what their issue was (and we consider ourselves hotel snobs)! Great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Loved every moment at this hotel”
Reviews.Author: KirstyBM
Reviews.Content: I've enjoyed a fantastic week with my family at this hotel. The staff are very friendly and helpful; the rooms are comfortable, spacious and very clean; every day complimentary milk and cookies were delivered to the kids room :) The hotel breakfast is the best I have ever had - a huge variety and the best of everything. If you want to stay near the old town then this isn't the hotel for you, but it's fabulous if you want to stay in a resort. It's right next door to the Polo Club and very close to Camp Nou where we did the museum tour, and even went to a Barca game. Taxis in Barcelona are reasonably priced and most days we caught them to visit places of interest. We also did the tourist bus and used the metro & tram services. Barcelona has so many attractions and there is always something new and amazing to see. The wifi service isn't great - 20€ per day, very slow and only one user at a time. If this is improved everything here would be perfect. The concierge service is 5-star, the pool & gardens are beautiful, there is a full-service fitness centre/spa available for a daily fee & the restaurant meals are very good. However, the room service is quite expensive in comparison to other dining options in Barcelona. I'll recommend this hotel to my friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Calm and relaxing oasis”
Reviews.Author: duisdeil
Reviews.Content: Airy, swish hotel with excellent facilities and great concierge staff. Its unique selling point is that it's not in the city centre or by the beach - so it's blissfully quiet, with gardens, two outdoor pools (one free) great views over the Polo grounds, Camp Nou, and the city towards the sea. It's a short walk from the metro and tram, but do use a taxi if arriving from the airport. Barcelona taxis are trustworthy and reasonably priced, and you'll reach the Rey Juan Carlos in around 15 minutes. (Or more likely 75 minutes as a sweaty bundle if you opt for train and metro). Food and drink is a touch pricy at the hotel but you have to expect that for a five star category. Some people seem to moan about the E16 charge for one of the pools - but remember this lets you use all the spa facilities, and is largely child-free, with 'jacuzzi beds' in the pool and refreshments on hand. Some great restaurants a short taxi/tram/metro ride away along Diagonal and into Eixample. May well be different when there's a big conference on at the adjoining centre - but then you won't be getting the great deals to stay then......

Reviews.Title: “Deduct a star”
Reviews.Author: Jensen48
Reviews.Content: Hotel Rey Juan Carlos is one of the cheapest 5-star hotels in Barcelona. And for one very good reason. The hotel is not worthy of 5-stars. Deducting one of them would be more honest as the service and facilities are not equal to what you may expect of a hotel that claims 5 stars. And why not? When I checked-in at the hotel on the 12th Of July this Summer the front desk trainee could not find my reservation and asked for assistance from a colleague. Well, this is what happens, but what does not happen at a 5-star hotel is that the colleague corrects and speaks in a harsh and very demanding tone to the trainee in front of a hotel guest. That really does not get your mood up. This was may first bad experience - and right on arrival. Unfortunately there were many more to come. Actually so many that it would be too much to mention them all here. One of the most "distracting" experiences came during the night. The hotel rooms are very noisy and you can hear everything going on in the other rooms from listening in on the other guests conversations to nightly activities between lovers. Therefore, I asked for another room in the morning. The front desk staff was very annoyed with my request, asking if this was necessary and the person in the reception "helping me out" did not once apoligies for this matter. Finally I got a new room after waiting for 3 hours. I should never have asked for this room as it was even more noisy than the old one. Again this is not a 5-star hotel worthy!!! During my 3 day stay, I had many disappointing experiences. Big ones and small ones that you may laugh of like the fact that the front desk staff did not know what a ”band aid” is and it took three people in the reception to get me one. And when I asked to borrow an iron, the hotel staff told me, that I could not borrow one for security reasons as it may set the building on fire. Well I stay more than 100 nights in hotels every year for business reasons, and this explanation from Hotel Rey Juan Carlos got me really scared, as it is usually never a problem to borrow an iron in a 5-star hotel. Right now I am in a 5-star hotel in Madrid, where I just borrowed and iron this afternoon. I hope nothing happens here tonight... In return Hotel Rey Juan Carlos did offer to iron my shirts for 7 euros a piece. Well perhaps this is more about business than security... Another fact that guest should be aware of is that the hotel is actually quite far away from the city life and the main attractions in Barcelona unless you want to go and see Camp Nou. Perhaps this explaines the low price as well. A more funny thing is, that in the hotel lobby there is a display showing all the celebrities that have earlier stayed at the hotel. Well I can only think, that a true 5-star hotel would not have to display such a thing... In other words. Hotel Rey Juan Carlos is one of the cheapest 5-star hotels in Barcelona, but do not expect a 5-star experience as it would be more honest to deduct a star and then your expectations would be more equal to what you actually get...

Reviews.Title: “noisy, selfish, non-professional, and theft!”
Reviews.Author: LondonTigger1
Reviews.Content: we arrived around 5pm, and the rooms were not ready. had to wait. none of the staff can speak proper english, very childish way of behaving. the worst things were; 1) they charged (we paid with booking) for spa access, but the receptionist of the spa said the spa is closed, the second day, they say, our room numbrers were not listed, i complained and asked for refund, but the manager of the hotel kept saying (in a childish manner, looked pathetic!) 'we can't do nothing!' (also gramatical mistake). so we lost 128 euro for nothing but batteling with this helpless untrainned (or uneducated maneger - who calls himself as a manager, but who knows!). in the end, they just say, 'you can go to spa now' which was 2 hours before our flight. and they deleted our expenses at bars and tax which was about 30 euro in total, but still we did not get to the spa and lost lots of money there for nothing due to their poor communication between the spa and the hotel, and we had to pay for it!!! we decided not to argue any longer since we realised that it's just waste of our energy and time. 2) do not stay here during weekends especially when they have wedding, or ask for the room farthest from the Garden. we had so much noise after 12am til 4am onwards by those weddings both friday and saturday. On saturday, they provided me a room to sleep at 2am! Sunday night was faboulusly quiet, and it would be so different if we stayed during weekdays. 3) the staffs except the manager are very friendly, but they do not seem to have any decision making, they had to ask someone else,- takes forever to get an answer! very slow. and I have seen the cleaners were cleaning even in the evening- short of staff for such a big hotel. 4) no kettle, and ask for a kettle, and charge us 3 euro. amazing! just like ryanair or something, every little costs! but no refund even it's their faults. the room was bit worn out. 5) if you want to go to Camp Nou, it's very close, and nice. but far from the metro or tram station (10 minutes walk) and no other shops around there. but the taxies are cheap in Spain, so it would be easier to go around by taxies which we did if you are 3-4 people. good thing? maybe it's close to the airport. and the bell boy was very helpful and friendly. that's all.

Reviews.Title: “No fresh air in rooms 24 hours and extra charges for gymnasium and internet use”
Reviews.Author: rosski69
Reviews.Content: Amazing that in a 5 star hotel no fresh air is allowed in bedrooms and compulsory 24 hour air conditioning.!!! For asthmatics and hay fever sufferers forget about staying at this hotel. Also outragious that after charging at 5 star rates they still extract more money if you wish to use gymnasium (health centre ) or internet facilities! To further insult guests intelligence they have a sign in the wardrobe saying its a safety risk for guests to iron their clothes and you must send ironing elsewhere ( and of course pay hotel MORE money to the hotel ) to do the ironing !!! Also there are several swimming pools but the only free one for guests is cold. If you want warm water to swim you pay extra !

Reviews.Title: “Mixed feelings”
Reviews.Author: hetman
Reviews.Content: About Euro110 for a night in a hotel like this looks like a good deal. Unless .... you don't mind Euro 20 for an internet (plus tax), Euro 25 for a breakfast (if you are lucky you can negotiate for a larger family, but the breakfast is good), and an unknown charge for an indoor pool (because it is with the spa; never seen hotel with a pool which is not free), then Euro 110 does not look like a bargain any more. Oh yes, and 150 euros for a 75 minute hot stone massage I paid for my wife for a (round number) birthday treatment was of a mediocre quality too, particularly given the price.In particular, I hated the sky-high internet price (in XXI century those things should be next to free). There is an outdoor (free!) swimming pool though, but only for summer. As to the birthday celebration: I paid for a champagne-strawberry-flowers delivery for the birthday morning. I didn't ask for some complimentary stuff (some say I should), but was nevertheless surprised when I realized that they didn't include even coffee with the room-delivery. Nothing unless you pay! The location is so-so. Indeed, it's only about 10 minutes walk to/from the metro but it takes at least 15-20 minutes to get to downtown (12-16 euros by taxi). The only real good thing we liked was coming back from a sightseeing during the lunch-time, relaxing at the outdoor pool, and then heading back to the city. Spending time on a metro wasn't the most exciting part but at least my daughter doesn't mind public transportation. By the way, there is nothing around where you could grab a substitute-breakfast. The service is perhaps a bit better than the Spanish average but the latter is really not an honorable benchmark. The most unpleasant thing was settling the bill very early in the morning with a typical local-level degree of politeness.

Reviews.Title: “Not as good as it pretends to be”
Reviews.Author: rs000
Reviews.Content: Supposedly a 5 star Leading Hotel of the World, this doesn't really measure up. Firstly the location is terrible - at the end of the green Metro line, 13 stations from Catalunya, so it's a 45-60 minute trip just to get into town. Then little things like non-working lights in the room, air conditioning that cannot be adjusted, shower door not fitting properly, etc. make me feel this does not deserve 5 stars. Plus they have the nerve to charge 20 Euros per day for a slow wifi internet connection. I will not be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “More like a mausoleum than a hotel”
Reviews.Author: imaging_man
Reviews.Content: More like a mausoleum than a hotel, the stark interior of the Rey Juan Carlos coupled with the largely inattentive staff made this my most disappointing hotel experience in 20 years. This is an expensive hotel but is not operated in a manner consistent with the cost. Despite being full of conference attendees, the hotel felt deserted during my stay. The food and drinks are so ludicrously expensive that virtually no one eats or drinks there. Internet access not only costs 20 euros (+VAT) per day but the network is so slow as to be useless, which is simply absurd in a business oriented hotel. There is no information in the room about services provided by the hotel or their location. On my third day I accidentally found that (free) breakfast was provided for conference attendees, I was not informed of this when checking in nor, as far as I could tell, was it advertized anywhere within the hotel. If you can find it, the hotel pool is wonderful, but we had to search as we were misdirected by the staff to the for-fee pool in the health spa. The architecture and décor don’t help, but more importantly the style in which the hotel is run seems to attach little importance to the guests actually enjoying their stay. It’s a shame as other than the hotel, my experience in Barcelona was wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “5 star hotel with 2 star internet service”
Reviews.Author: MMmd
Reviews.Content: This is as good a high quality business hotel as I have ever stayed at. It is difficult to understand the very negative comments left on tripadvisor from some customers as my experience was very different. The prices of food and drink at this hotel are high compared to US hotels, but are really comparable to other “5 star” hotels in major European cities. I have 4 comments: a) Location. This hotel is away from the city centre and about a 15 minute taxi ride from the airport (20 euro minimum fare applied). There is a metro stop 5 minutes walk away and getting to any of the major sites or city centre involves a change. The metro is very easy to use, clean and frequent. Be aware that if you are coming for a convention, this may be some distance away. There are several convention centres in Barcelona and although one is virtually attached to the hotel, the main one (FIRA Gran Via) is a 20minute taxi ride away. b) The internet service at this hotel is poor and expensive. The cost of the internet service is 8/12/20 euro (without VAT which is 16% extra) for 1/2/24 hours respectively. The time is not transferable and once you start the period is continuous. The speed of the internet connection is really poor at whatever price. I mainly used the internet to deal with emails but it was painfully slow, irrespective to the time of day or night. I wonder if the management of this hotel ever do undercover work by looking at their competition. This is the most expensive and slowest internet service I have encountered in a hotel in the last 3 years. c) All prices at the hotel are exclusive of VAT which you pay on top on checking out. Can there really be any justification for not showing the true prices within the hotel? After all everywhere else you go in Spain all the prices include VAT. d) On checking out, you are meant to do so at the Cashier desk but there is no notice informing you of this. I stood in line for around 10-15 min for reception with everybody else checking in, only to be told they couldn’t check me out and I should go to the cashier desk instead. It will be such a simple thing for the hotel to put up signs making it clear that the check in and check out take place at different desks.

Reviews.Title: “Very Handy for the Conference Centre”
Reviews.Author: DurbanGal
Reviews.Content: Just stayed one night and it was great, walking distance to the convention centre. Clean, comfortable and great service at desk.

Reviews.Title: “Not really a resort”
Reviews.Author: travelsnob18
Reviews.Content: The website is a bit deceiving for this "resort" hotel. My husband and I just returned from a trip to Barcelona. We chose this hotel based on the website and the idea of relaxing by the pool during our stay with outings in the evening for dinner and drinks. Cons: - Of the two pools, one was competely unopen without seating, service, etc. - The most appealing pool was attached to the spa and required a 16 Euro pp entry fee in addition to the hotel rate. The day we attempted to go to that pool, the spa was only partially available as they were filming some sort of video in the fitness areas & the pool bar was unopen. We were told we could only get water to drink. We declined to pay as it seemed unreasonable to pay for limited ammenities at this "resort". - Registration was a slow and painful process as we stood waiting to be acknowledged by one of the 4 seemingly available employees behind the counter. Finally we had to be rude an just force ourselves on someone... anyone... - Location is far off the beaten path. It isabout a 5 minute walk to the subway, but we had to change lines n order to get to the more popular destinations (La Segrada Familia, Gracia neighborhood, Las Ramblas) - Rooms did not look like the website photos.

Reviews.Title: “THIS HOTEL IS TERRIBLE! FIND ANOTHER PLACE!”
Reviews.Author: JoJoSurf
Reviews.Content: I used this hotel for business because of its location to the Conference Center and my stay has been nothing but problems. 1. Problems with reservation - hotel could not find my (or my 3 colleagues') reservation, even though I had an actual printout. They were able to accommodate but only after 15 minutes of waiting around the registration desk. 2. We had cancelled two reservations approximately a week prior to our arrival but the hotel is claiming a 'no show.' Again, I have a printout of the cancellation that clearly confirms the cancellation. 3. Internet is 20 Euros and there is a charge to use the pool. I have never been to a "5-star" where you are asked to pay to swim. Fitness and swim is 16 euros. 4. Iron not provided - again, they do ask you to give shirts for laundry...for a hefty charge of 12 euros a shirt. 5. My king bed is made of two smaller beds just pushed together which are not very comfortable to begin with. I would recommend going to another hotel and not staying here. The hotel is very clean and the staff do seem relatively helpful but find another place, especially given the price.

Reviews.Title: “Buyer Beware”
Reviews.Author: hadd0ck
Reviews.Content: Buyer beware. Do not stay here unless you like being ripped off and don't want to see the city of Barcelona. I spent 3 nights here with my wife in spring 2010 and I agree totally with some of the other reviews that describe this hotel's pricing as "abusive". An example of some of the ridiculous charges at this hotel: 20 Euro extra a night for internet? (That didn't work the entire time we were there.) 25 Euro extra a night for the 'privilege' of having a second person in a room (my wife)? (Evidently breakfast costs 25 Euro! and I was told it was not possible to opt out of it). 15 Euro to wash and dry one shirt. The rest of the food prices are just insane, literally. Oh, one of the receptionist at the front desk actually told us that "there are no lavandarias in Barcelona". (I have spent ~3 months in BCN, you can get your entire wardrobe cleaned for 15 Euro at lavandarias scattered on every block in the city). This gives you an idea of the quality of the reception desk. What a total joke. The hotel is also a very long way away from the center of the city -- the walk to the metro takes about 10 minutes and is the last stop on the metro's green line. If you are used to the typical Barcelona hotel that has many restaurants, cafes and other conveniences in a 2 block radius then this is not the place for you.
