If you are used to having really anything useful nearby this hotel is not for you. Another caution for anyone looking for a romantic getaway: beware this hotel's double room/single room groupings. We reserved a double room for two people and found two beds pushed together, bedded separately, with one comforter thrown overtop to give the illusion of a king-sized bed. It took an additional trip to the front desk to get us moved to a room with one bed that would sleep two people. And then it was a "shared room"--the kind with a locked door that could be opened to lead into the room next to us. And by the way, our room's shower leaked into the bathroom through a crack in the tile so if you needed to use the toilet you would first need to mop up. The A/C unit in the room we were in (and all the rooms I saw) rattled very very loudly when running. The beds are extremely hard. Be prepared for all this when you try to go to sleep. Basically, this hotel caters to customers with an expense account who are here to use the conference center. If that is you and you don't care about being charged an arm and a leg for every basic need and like being close to your conference, then go ahead and book. The hotel will feel the same to you as any standard 3 star hotel in the US and since your company is paying, who cares. However, if you actually care about getting what you pay for then my advice is to go find a different hotel. You can pay 1/2 as much for 2x more elsewhere. In summary, for all its attempts to be a "Leading Hotel of the World," it failed miserably in our opinion. The abusive charges, poor room quality, isolated location, dingy business district surroundings and poor customer service will keep us from ever returning to Hotel Rey Juan Carlos in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Paradise near Camp Nou”
Reviews.Author: Ismo56
Reviews.Content: Me and my wife spent four days in beautiful Barcelona. This was my first 5 star hotel, and the place was full of surprises. WAU !!!, was the first word that came into my mind when arriving at the lobby. Our room was big enough, huge bathroom had a shower and a bathtub that i love. Breakfast was about half priced, because we paid it when booking this hotel through Booking.com. I have never had such a breakfast, lot of good stuff, warm and cold. We normally had our dinner at the Centre of Barcelona, because we thought dinner in this Hotel would be too expensive to our budget, but during the last evening, we walked to Hotel Restaurant, and ordered Dinner that was extremely delicious, and also quite cheap, so don't be afraid. We had tickets to a football match FCBarcelona against Villareal in Camp Nou. It was nice to live no near, because one can walk to the Stadium and also back from there. One has to see this HULABALOO once in a lifetime. The only slihgly negative point was that this lovely paradise is not in the centre. One has to travel 10-15 minutes in Metro to get to LaRambla. This was not a problem for us, because we bought 3-day ticket for both of us. In summertime Juan Carlos is even more beautifula and paradiselike, because it has large gardens and swimmingpool areas outside.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel close to Camp Nou”
Reviews.Author: Piet005
Reviews.Content: A very nice and good hotel, just outside the center. With Metro Line 3 (5 min walking) you can reach the Ramblas in 12 min. We had booked 2 rooms (1 parents, 1 teenagers). The rooms were quite big, very nice bathroom, seperate toilet. The breakfast was extremely good, with all fresh stuff and an enormous selection of cold and warm items. A delicious start of the day. The swimming pool was unfortunately closed during Xmas. In case you can book this hotel for a nice (off season) price, it is worth to be just outside the centre. Next to that, it is just 10min away from the super stadium of FCB Camp Nou. Everybody should visit this place, even people who do not like football: it is a tremendous experience, incl. the FCB museum.

Reviews.Title: “Bad impresion”
Reviews.Author: Nasia_10
Reviews.Content: I spend 4 nights in this hotel , after reading the critics of this site. The truth is that I had read only the good news. I reserved two rooms deluxe with break fast included directly from the site of the hotel. It's true that is not close to the center of the town , but it's near (not close) the airport. Half an hour from airport by taxi. And half an hour from the center by metro and walking . there is a station near. The area is quiet but there is nothing thre for shopping or eating. Two station far ther are a Shopping mall an the Camp Nou. The rooms are good but not something excepcional comparing with other hotels of 5 or 4 stars in the same town. The ventilation was not suficient because the window (1rst floor) was permanently secured in the "close" position. The cleaning service was good but the bed-sheets were either being changed day by day or were not well -ironed. We haven't touched or opened the mini-bar , where a small bottle of natural water cost 5 euros. In other hotels, at least, u have 2 bottles of water for free. In the supermarket the same bottles of water cost 0,40 euros. The room-service was neither slow nor very fast but was very very expensive basis the quality of the food served. It;s not acceptable to serve " fast food" french fries. Which means were frozen and we paid aroud 20 euros for that hamburger. In the breakfast, there were a varity of items to select however I doubt about the quality. For many items I'm not sure when they were prepared e.g bacon very hard with strange taste, croissants not fresh , tortilla previous day remaing , coffee prepared hours ago and in great quantity so its appearance was black- not brown, as coffee has to be, and bitter. The jam was not the best quality ever seen, had the appearence of a jelly. The polo restaurant , the cold buffet cost arround 26 euros and the cold buffet with specialties( menu dishes) arround 40 euros. The kids menu approx. 19 euros... for a pasta with tomato sauce. I have noticed that there was a kind of " policy" to discourage clients- not prohibit- of having a second plate from the buffet. The presentation of the buffet was excelent. The food served in the buffet were mostly vegetables ,chicken and salamis. In the site of the hotel they offer high speed internet without clarifying that it is charched 8 euros/hour 12 euros /2hours 20/24hours which must be consumed the same day otherwise you lose the remaining unused time. Considering that the internet is offered almost everywhere for free, even in cafes , and in the majority of the hotels it is standard free service , it's totaly unacceptable to charge such amounts in a hotel of such class. Furthermore it;s not logical to pay extra 100 euros/day at least to have free internet, in the excecutive floor, among the additional meal services and newspapers. Generaly the behaviour of the personel was good , very kind. The entrance of the fittnes center was approx 23 euros , and was not clariied whether this amount is for the thermal area only.In addition there was no information about the fitness room use of exercise equipment was free or not . I haven,'t visited the spa area although i would like to cause I felt that the strategy of the hotel is to offer nothing complimentary or for free. However they suggest for FREE a route for jogging arround the hotel area. I haven't visit the bar cause I have n't seen the piano used by a musician. The truth is that If someone wants to visit the town and pay by him/herself is better not go to this Hotel, you'd better avoid it. We have visited many hotels around the world and I would say that this hotel is a 5starGL presentation with 2 stars attitude.

Reviews.Title: “Decent but Overhyped hotel”
Reviews.Author: BK80
Reviews.Content: This was my first visit to this hotel and I found it to be a decent but over-hyped hotel. 1) Location: Close to the international airport, it takes about 10 minutes and costs around 15 euros to reach the hotel. I would rate them 8.5 on a scale of 10 for this factor 2) Business Facilities: Well one do get everything in the hotel but for everything you have to pay additionally. In these kind of hotels generally one expects all the facilities to be inclusive in the room tariff. So this came as a surprise. A 7.5 to them for this factor. 3) Food: This again comes as a weak point for a traveler from India. You don’t find many choices if you eat only chicken in non-veg. And if you are a vegetarian, the situation is even worse as there is only 1 dish available in the 24hour menu. The worst part is that you don’t have any McDonald’s (the lifesaver) nearby. A 5 to them for this 4) Comfort; Hospitality; Customer Satisfaction: The rooms are ofcourse great and the hospitality is impeccable. However the above two factors leaves you wanting for more in terms of customer satisfaction and hence a 8 to them on this factor..

Reviews.Title: “A bit out of the way, but well worth it.”
Reviews.Author: vacationsrforus
Reviews.Content: This hotel is not to close to the Las Ramblas and looks ultra modern and boring on the outside. We were pleasantly surprised when we went in, it is beautiful. The rooms were well appointed and very comfortable. The staff was friendly and helpful, we would go back there in a heart beat. The hotel is clean and welcoming.

Reviews.Title: “Great congress hotel”
Reviews.Author: jesscar111
Reviews.Content: I spent 4 great nights in this hotel during a congress event. Everything was excellent, rooms, service, restaurant.Very friendly staff, eager to help. Congratulations to management!

Reviews.Title: “Super hotel, great staff.”
Reviews.Author: JohnJB
Reviews.Content: I was only in town for one night for a business dinner at this hotel so stayed here. The hotel is some way outside of the main tourist areas in a nice, peaceful part of town, a few hundred yards from Barcelona FC's Camp Nou Stadium and next to the Royal Barcelona Polo Club. There is a Metro stop nearby that takes you down to the Gothic quarter. It has every facility you could wish for plus elegant restaurants, classy bars etc., most of which seem to be aimed at their business clientele, but would be just as appealing to the tourist. I was very impressed by the staff who were very welcoming and quietly efficient. My room was super - not overly large but certainly not cramped. Again everything had been thought about and was present in the room - no frantic calls to reception to ask for x,y or z to be sent up. The bathroom deserves a special mention - big tub, separate power shower, all marble and mirror - gorgeous. I booked with 1-800 Hotels and got a great deal - just £125 for the night. If I return to Barcelona at any time I certainly won't be looking for an alternative, the Rey Juan Carlos ticks all the boxes.

Reviews.Title: “Abusive pricing”
Reviews.Author: Ann_Onimme
Reviews.Content: The people who gave this hotel a rating of 5 dots must have had their bill paid by someone else... over 5 Euro for a coffee, over 13 Euro for a bottle of mineral water (50cl, Fiji) - you can spend an evening in a tapas bar in town for less than that1 - everything in the Business Centre (always empty, no surprise) - other people have already commented on Internet access charges (but there is no alternative anywhere near). While the rooms are very good, the rest is of questionable quality - breakfast was poor for a hotel of this class - tepid (cold really) scrambled eggs, a limited selection of fresh fruit, doubtful coffee. The Leading Hotels of the World group should do more audits and drop this one from the list.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel but expensive extras.”
Reviews.Author: Genath
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights at this 5 star hotel. It was very comfortable the rooms well appointed and great views. Although it was good value in terms of the price we paid for the room including breakfast, all the extras were very over priced, subsequently we didn't use any of them and brought in our own wine, water, snacks etc. Its a shame because if it were more reasonable more people would use the minibar, spa etc. and I'm sure they would make much more money in the long run. We used the outdoor pool for free, I think the indoor pool was charged at the spa rate.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful treat”
Reviews.Author: Uranus7
Reviews.Content: My husband found a good deal on the room and we went for it. The foyer was impressive, the concierges were very helpful. There were so many little touches that made it a pleasurable stay. We had breakfast in bed one morning - expensive but definitely worth it (anything we didn't eat we made into a snack for lunchtime). The hotel is a little distance from the city centre but the Metro was very convenient (10-trip tickets were only Eu7.70). I would love to go here again!

Reviews.Title: “too expensive”
Reviews.Author: Gizmo2001
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel, but it is located a long way from everything. Service was as expectet. Pool was a bit from the hotel, not ideal.

Reviews.Title: “Incredibly bad service”
Reviews.Author: ZorroF
Reviews.Content: I write our story, which shouldn`t be written after a vacation in a 5-star hotel. We booked our room "DELUXE with lounge service including four gastronomic presentations" via Expedia. When we arrived to hotel, they claimed that we had only booked normal double room. Fortunately I had printed all information from the pages from Expedia and took those papers with me. When I gave those papers to clerk, she told that she had to talk to manager. Next day we were told to come back to reception (while waiting next day no food was offered). They said that lounge was closed and it wouldn`t be opened. Reason wasn`t told. They offered us free breakfasts. We accepted it, even though it was not at all same than "four gastronomic presentations". Everything was quite ok, until we saw that lounge was open. We went there to ask if it was opened for us too. The lounge clerk said that it was only for private party. So we waited for two more days and noticed that lounge was open all day long. We went back to ask it, and another clerk said that it was open for those who had bought it. So we went back to reception and they said that we couldn`t use lounge because we had accepted free breakfasts. BREAKFAST IS NOT THE SAME THAN FOUR GASTRONOMIC PRESENTATIONS IN PRIVATE LOUNGE. Our opinion was nothing. What next: I have never been in a 5-star hotel, where hotel employees can bring their friends to pool area and these "guests" occupy real guests sun beds. And these friends can enjoy their own food and beverages by pool, which was strictly prohibited from hotel guests. These "guests" came to pool via pool bar, where nobody controlled their coming. Hotel guests had to come via Fitness center reception, where room number was told. And what next, Fitness bar`s employee´s boyfriend was all day long behind this bar desk kissing the employee. Such a nice seen from teenagers in the streets, but ugly when having a holiday in this class hotel. When leaving hotel, they tried still charge us from several breakfasts. And they had to call to supervisor to correct (there was "FREE BREAKFASTS" text, anybody could have seen it without supervisor)! So after all, we didn`t get what we had paid beforehand. And service was really rude. Smiling was just fake. I wrote a complaint few days after we got back home (about 2 months ago). Nobody has replied for that. Well... I`m not surprised. Also choose this hotel if you 1) like to pay 17 euros for a drink and 30 euros for simpliest meal 2) want to travel with taxi/metro/bus to city center, you can`t reach it by foot 3) want to feel that money makes people worth good service. I never go back.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, slightly below LHW standards”
Reviews.Author: doledes
Reviews.Content: I recently had a 2 night stay at this hotel, here are my PRO & CONS. PRO: The reception is very efficient. I e-mailed them the day before about my arrival time (9.30 am) and they quicly answered me; once arrived, they assigned me immediately my room and gave me an invitation for a CAVA cocktail in one of the bars of the hotel. The lobby is spectacular, as described in other rewies. My standard room was quiet big, there was an LCD, an armchair with a table, a sofa, a pillow menu and all the other things I usually find in a 5 star hotel. The bathroom had a big bathub and a separate WC area and a (little) shower. Excelent bath products (there were even a razor kit, a dental kit and a comb). The pool is amazing and this is probaby the cheapest 5 star hotel of the city. CONS: on one day the breakfast room was full, so last customers were constrincted to have breakfast in an adjacent room. The waiter told me (in Spanish..) how this room was located and that there was no difference in term of selection of food but instead I noted that the selection of fruit was smaller and the hot chocolate was worse than the one I had in the principal breakfast room (located at the Polo restaurant). I don't think this is acceptable in every hotel of this world because all the guests pay the same price for breakfast. And I found this restaurant quiet disappointing for being the principal restaurant of a 5 star hotel because is located in a room without windows. Another cons is about SPA's prices: I am a frequent LHW customer and I found HRJC very expensive. All in all, this is a very good hotel for people who look for a beautiful pool, some luxury at reasonable price and don't need to stay in the city center (anyway easyble accessible with the metro). But if you look for a real 5 star luxury hotel, probably you'll be quiet disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Overrated”
Reviews.Author: PalmSpringsBob
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival, due to AMEX Platinum, we were afforded an early check in and upgraded to a Junior Suite, not on the preferred side of the hotel overlooking the main part of Barcelona. It is a beautiful property, dramatic architecture, tastefully designed rooms and appointments. The staff is professional, but not eagerly helpful. Hold on to your breakfast plate and silverware for they'll grab it off the table quicker than the eye can see it. The amenities are not just expensive, but outrageous. We've stayed in 5* hotels all over the world and RJC takes it. While even less expensive hotels in the city have free internet access, RJC charges 20 EU (that's about $30)per DAY!! Want a shirt pressed for dinner, 10EU and an iron and board in the room, "I'm afraid that's quite impossible!". Grounds and pool are nice, maybe by Barcelona standards, great, but by 5* standards, they're adequate. Everywhere you'll want to go, business or pleasure, unless you're going to the convention center, next door, will be a very expensive taxi ride, 20 EU or you're trapped in the hotel. Food and food service is mediocre at best. Thankfully, a Mandarin will be opening soon in a beautiful location near the water and the city center.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel outside the centre of Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: worldtraveler12345
Reviews.Content: I had an excellent 3-night stay at the Rey Juan Carlos. The room and bathroom merit the hotel's 5* rating. Moreover, the swimming pool is fantastic. Other potential guests should however bear in mind that the hotel is quite isolated and that there are no restaurants and shops within walking distance of the hotel. Although I had a great stay, I identified two areas in which the hotel's management could make an effort to make their guests' stay even more enjoyable. 1. Although there are some shops selling jewelry and expensive designer clothes in the hotel, there is no shop selling basic toiletries. My luggage was lost by my airline and as there are no shops within walking distance of the hotel I had to take a taxi in the morning to buy deodorant and other basic supplies. Moreover, most shops outside the center of Barcelona only open around 10/11AM. I think it would be great if the hotel could stock some basic toiletries for its guests. 2. As already mentioned by other guests, the internet service is overpriced (EUR 28/day) and worse the service that is provided is very slow.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in the middle of nowhere that has steep charges for everything.”
Reviews.Author: BostonWino
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a conference and the room was covered, so I can't complain about the price of that. The room was very small but clean, and included all the usual 5 star services. But lord, do they make you pay for everything else! Wireless internet access? 8 Euros PER HOUR! A snifter of Spanish brandy at the bar? 18 Euros. Cold buffet dinner? 27 Euros. Want to find a nice local place for less expensive and more authentic food and drink? Good luck. There's a metro station a 10 minute walk away, and 10 stops and 20 minutes later later, you will be in the heart of Barcelona where you can find such things, but not here. Oh well.

Reviews.Title: “The height of luxury - if you can afford it!”
Reviews.Author: Lexiloola
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I visited this hotel for two nights in May, and got an excellent rate through Expedia. Don't be put off by the grey tower block - the hotel interior and facilities are absolutely lush, in particular the pools, spa and fitness area which were lovelier than any other I've been to (even my expensive London gym). Its worth the stay just to use those facilities, especially on a hot hot day when you are sticky and sweaty after sightseeing. It's about 15-20 minutes into the centre of Barcelona by bus or metro from the Avenue Diagonal, and even after a big night out (in La Ribera - definitely preferable to the tacky Las Ramblas), we managed to find a bus home at 2am. The room was great - a massive bed, huge windows with a great view of Barcelona, and the most amaaaazing shower I can remember. My only advice - if you are not made of money, bring your own drinks and snacks for the room, and eat out locally rather than at the hotel. Each room has a minibar but - phew - costs started with a small pack of Pringles at 7 euros! Breakfast (which we ate out at a little cafe) was extortionate - 16 euros for a fruit platter, 5 euros for cereal and milk. Enough said. But we brought our own Pringles (we are v classy like that...!) and were more than happy squeezing our bottle of wine into the minibar fridge. I would definitely stay here again next time we visit Barcelona, if only for the splendid pool, lovely gardens and excellent spa.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: GNJP
Reviews.Content: Cant go wrong everything 1s class - service, breakfast, rooms, value, pools, spa, lobby, great for both pleasue and buisness. dont be put off that it is not in city centre- with metro, taxi, bus and tram very easy to get to where you want. Its away fom the mass crowds, there is excellent shopping near by and easy reach to airport.

Reviews.Title: “The Leading Hotels of the World - 09LHW03 - The new image of Barcelona! Spectacular!”
Reviews.Author: Flyer007Dublin
Reviews.Content: Our fourth time in Spain and our first time in Barcelona, Folks! Well done! We had flown from Dublin with BMI - British Midlands - to London-Heathrow ( T1 ) and from London-Heathrow ( T3 ) - to Barcelona El Prat International ( Term. B ) with Iberia and same return to Dublin after our superb weekend in Barcelona at this truly spectacular Hotel. And so it goes, Folks! The Taxi from El Prat Int. to the hotel was 21 Euros and had taken around 15 minutes time and return from the hotel to El Prat Int. was 23 Euros and again 15 minutes depending on traffic as you would expect. A magnificent building to behold, this was the first ever image of this hotel and it had taken it' s hold in our memory. We were greeted in the massive and beautiful Atrium by an fast and efficient check-in, welcome drinks ( Bellini Cava Cocktails for two ) in the Aris Bar which we have taken after 18:00 PM in the clubby atmosphere of this Lobby located Bar. The Cocktails had been delicious. At the Aris Bar smoking is permitted. We had a personal welcome by our host named Raquel, she has given us explanation about the hotel, restaurants and all functions in our superb Deluxe Double room - nr. 1031 - on the tenth floor with views over the magnificent Tennis club and the mountainous surroundings beyond. The Bellboy delivered our luggage within two minutes of arrival in our superb room and again he explained to us the functions in the room. Service to be proud of! Our room was large, fantastic design, superb twin beds with allergy pillows as requested. We had the hotel booked via LHW.COM - because the hotel is also a member of The Leading Hotels of the World! Ltd. and the General Manager Mr. Roberto Torregrosa was awarded the best Hotel manager in Spain in 2008, and it show' s, Folks! OK, back to our room - nr. 1031 - we had a large Philips Plasma LCD TV with many international channels on offer incl. spanish, saudi arabian, french ( Canal + ), Bloomberg TV, American Fox News, CNN, BBC World News, Eurosport, Sky News, German Channels, MTV, Italian channels, Al Jazeera Arabic news channel and many others. Also on offer had been Pay-TV services from new releases via action to adult movies - each 15 Euros. We also found the following in our room incl. large writing desk, large luggage rack - located beside writing desk -, high-end wooden and upholstered furniture incl. coffee table, sofa chairs, bed-head-board, TV rack was with super large safe - the largest we have seen so far! - We also had on the room the following incl. blue-yellow carpet, limited edition prints x2 handmade on the wall, 6 light sources plus a few power outlets - incl. Bathroom. The room itself had a superb colour coordination between the furniture items, mostly in light brown, yellow and black colour schemes with yellow/cream tapestry. We also had in-room wired internet connection, a pillow menu, fully stocked mini-Bar which incl. the following items incl. Juices by Zumosol ( Pascual ), Beer, Vodkas, Gin, Cava and Snacks incl. Twix, Toblerone, Pringles and Chips Ahoi Cookies. All priced between 5 - to 7 Euros for the snacks and also incl. in the bar was the following incl. Absolut Vodka, Jack Daniel' s, Bombay Saphire plus many many more items priced between 10 Euros - to 13 Euros, also available had been Mineral Water, Coca Cola, Orange and Pineapple juice, all priced 5 Euros. The mini-Bar was integrated into the large wardrobe. The wardrobe itself had 15 hangers and can accomodate quiet a lot of clothing, which brings into our minds longstayer and families. Also services on offer incl. 24 h room-service, laundry-service and the rather comprehensive - always welcome - Questionaire. The Bathroom, Folks! Right here, Right now! The complete Bathroom was in polished granite and marble combination. The Bathroom size was medium to large which incl. appliances by Grohe, incl. large freestanding bathtub, medium sized freestanding shower, bidet and toilet ( by Roca Gondola ), which was seperated by a sliding door from the main bathroom - the same with the shower unit! The own-branded Bathroom amenities had been produced exclusively for this stunning hotel by Lande of Madrid and incl. dental kit, razor kit, comb, bath gel, shampoo and body milk -aptly named body crema! - plus tissues, soap, shower cap and two glasses for tooth brushes and a lot of space for personal cosmetics. The Bathroom also incl. the following items as observed by both of us incl. weighing scale,moving hand-held shower, sink ( by Roca ) with large counter space incl. Valera - Switzerland - hairdryer - 1800 watt - plus make/up - shaver mirror combination which can be lighted provided by Hans Grohe. Also provided had been the following incl. bath towels, hand towels plus 2 bathrobes! All in all the bathroom was just perfect, a combination of relaxation and modernity plus the luxury of time for oneself! Overall the hotel Rey Juan Carlos, The First can be described as AWSOME in every sense of the word. It was opened in 1992 after only 649 days of construction time! Today it is one of the best hotels in Spain, Europe and the World. The hotel has a twelve story atrium, 7 Restaurants plus Bar plus room services, friendly associates everywhere with a smile, modern art all the way, dramatic atrium lighting with flying mushrooms, piano player in the lobby bar incl. Cappuccino, Kahlua Coffee, Iskilde Water from Denmark, Blueberry muffins which were still warm! We had also the aforementioned welcome drink at the Aris Bar plus Room service Dinner which incl. Turbot, Steak, Vegetables - greens - Creme Catalan, Vichy Catalan Water - 1L - and Mandarin creme which all came at 89 Euros incl. VAT and Service. In the morning the breakfast at the Polo Restaurant is just in one word fantastic! They truly offer everything imaginable incl. we had waffles, fresh fruits, chesse incl. Mahon from Menorca, Eggs, Yoghurt by Danone, superb coffee, Special K, Juices incl. Pineapple-grape, carrot-orange combinations plus a superb fresh bread offerings and cured spanish ham and more and more! We could eat for hours there! The Surroundings outside of the hotel are equally awsome incl. stables, superb gardens, private lake with swans - black and white - pathways, Royal Fitness club, superb children' s playground, The Garden Restaurant, The Spa, massive Swimming-pools and, and, and! Fantastic all the way. This hotel is just amazing in every respect it is named after the King of Spain and it was opened by the King of Spain plus a large portrait in the Atrium from the King of Spain as the eyes and ears of the hotel, managed by Husa Hoteles of Spain! Highly recommended! By the way, Newspapers from around the world are available which incl. Papers from Japan, USA and Brazil and many many more priced at 3 Euros each. Every other paper can be found by hotel from the employees when not available in the hotel. Amazing! So do not forget: FLY,STAY,EXPLORE! MORE! do it now and right!

Reviews.Title: “affordable luxury”
Reviews.Author: viaggisaggi
Reviews.Content: If you don't mind the location (the place is quite far from downtown, let's say 10 euros by taxi) i recommend you to check this hotel. I've been there a couple of times and been able to get affordable rates, and get to stay in a 5+ stars hotel. Very nice lobby, very spacious and well manned rooms, a lot of attention to details. Breakfast is super, but if you can please avoid the restaurant (nothing special about it, and expensive

Reviews.Title: “Hardest beds you've ever slept on”
Reviews.Author: jeffreyrsears
Reviews.Content: This is a 5 star rated and very nice hotel in most standard measures - great service, nice design, good restaurants, and nice rooms. However, as a business traveler you expect to have a decent bed to sleep on after flying for 10+ hours to get here. Unfortunately, their beds are rock hard. No padding whatsoever. I complained to the hotel manager and they put a pathetic 1 inch padding. While that was a little help it still was like sleeping on a granite slab with a little padding. Bottom line, I would NOT recommend this hotel for anybody who likes to get a good night's sleep. Your back will be sore for days. Ouch!

Reviews.Title: “Near Convention Center - Bring Your Wallet”
Reviews.Author: ordflyer
Reviews.Content: Located a fair distance away from the city center – only about a 20€ taxi ride from the airport, this hotel is located nearly on top of the convention center. A bit of a throw back to the 80's with a very high atrium, open spaces and a dramatic feel as you enter. If you are attending a convention, this is a great place to stay – from a location perspective. Just in front of the convention center is a metro station, which you can take advantage of. The rooms are clean and simple, we stayed on the executive floor. Nothing in this hotel, is inexpensive. Put it another way, bring your wallet. A 250ml coke is 5€. So is a water. A simple dish out of room service will easily be 20-25€, and dinner in the restaurant will set you back 26€ for the buffet (cold only) and nearly 50€ if you include a hot dish. Add a drink or wine on top of that and it adds up. Internet is 20€ a day. Functionally, this is a good hotel if you are going to the convention center – but it has figured out that business people are going to be staying there – and is priced that way.

Reviews.Title: “Awful hotel”
Reviews.Author: artemisiaannua
Reviews.Content: This was one of the worst hotels I have ever visited. We arrived at lunchtime in the first week of September only to find that the only restaurant open was by the pool where we were treated to expensive and obviously frozen and poorly re-heated pizzas. The hotel is on the outskirts of Barcelona near a busy main road and there is no choice of other restaurants nearby. The room was dingy and the bed the hardest I have ever sat on - we didn't sleep there as we had checked out by 5pm and went elsewhere. Our bill for lunch and the £70.00 cancellation fee was £190.00. A complete disgrace.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic”
Reviews.Author: nmcdowall
Reviews.Content: arrived at the hotel for our 3 day break slightly before the check in time. The lobby is absolutely beautiful when you enter the hotel. The reception and concierge teams were very helpful. As a special treat we had upgraded to the executive floor (which is well recomended) , we were invited to have a drink in the lobby whilst our own concierge came to meet us. We were given a tour of the hotel and some knowledge of local area and history. We were invited to the executive lounge which is only available for use for people staying on the executive floor. There was a complementory bar serving tea, coffee and most importantly, alcohol. The concierge team dedicated to our floor would not let you lift a finger and always helped with any requests with a smile on their faces. Also in the exec lounge there was fresh food out to sample (or fill your face) which was refreshed every 2-3 hours. There was also a bottle of champagne on table at all times for you to drink free of charge.The hotel room was beautiful, ours had an amazing view of camp nou. The hotel was very pricey but you come to expect this from a hotel which is listed in the worlds leading hotels. The spa which we used one day was excellent and a wonderful way to unwind from what was becoming an extremely busy break. It would of been nice to be able to share the facilities, but it was also nice to get away from the mrs for a couple of hours. The only downside of this break was that las ramblas is a little shadey of a night time, you have to be wary of pick pockets etc. This is not normally within our price budget but the room upgrade is recommended and made this experience a whole lot better. Would love to go back to this hotel again someday.

Reviews.Title: “love barcelona”
Reviews.Author: saif_bntheeyazin
Reviews.Content: first of all, i shall confirm the plus point... 1. the hotel room is very clean 2. the area is safe 3. the location of the hotel is near the metro (underground) station in addition normal taxis are always in front of the main gate. 4.shower and bath is wonderfull negative point. 1. far away from the city 2. no near by resturant or shops ( there is small shop in the near by petrol station) 3.hotel doesnt provide arrival gift such as bottle of water, or chocolate or fruit basket. 4. internet is around 20 euro per day 5. check in must be after 2pm if u arrive earlier they will not give you the room no matter what. general point hotel located near universities area, nice park near by, end of the street there are many small malls and shops.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but in it for the Money”
Reviews.Author: Jtq4u
Reviews.Content: I am just coming to the end of a stay at this hotel for the IBM WebSphere Conference. First impressions are that it is an impressive building (with the lobby full building height and the rooms balconied off it and a glass walled lift). The rooms are very nice, with a large bed and sofa, as well as the usual office area for work in the evening. TV was replaced with a trendy LCD one during my stay there. Bathroom is OK (though mine had cracked glass in the door dividing the toilet area from the bath area and a cracked sink, which you wouldn't expect from a 5* hotel. Nice live piano music echo's up the structure to the rooms in the evenings which is nice too. However all this was spoilt for me by the hotels agressive money focus. Even with our conference bulk booking reduction the price was 240E a night (bed and buffet breakfast), which in it's self isn't too bad for a five star hotel, however they seem to have managed to exclude absolutely everything from this. - On arrival I was shocked there was no tea and coffee.. and not even a bottle of water to drink or a biscuit. Had I wanted to pay 5E i could have had a small 250ml bottle of water from the fridge. - Should I want a Twix I could pay 7E yes 7E (1000% mark up). I instead payed 22E for a disgusting raw burger with fries (the fries were good). - My friend couldn't get an iron to iron her shirts because they insist you use their ironing service, which cost more than the shirt. - A film on the tv costs 14E - Swimming is included but on the third day of swimming i was told I must buy a swim hat at 6E which they insisted on cash for and would not put on my room. I hadn't brought cash funnily enough because they won't let guests have a key to a locker without becoming a yearly member of the leisure club. You have to take your clothes and leave them pool side. shameful. - After all this price stress you might like to unwind with a dip in the jaccuzi/hot tub by the pool. But this isn't included you would have to pay another 20E to use this. I am still here at the moment but I sudder in fear at what they will have charged me per toilet flush or for each breath of air. I stay in various 5* hotels but expect at least some of the basics to be included. My company gives us a daily allowance for food etc on top of the room rate. we can't expense everything like some people can.. so this is totally unacceptable.

Reviews.Title: “Well placed for Barcelona Congress Hall”
Reviews.Author: crimpsby
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel to attend a conference in the adjoining Palau de Congressos. On arrival we were told our room was on a smoking floor even though it was mentioned that the hotel was aware that we had booked a nonsmoking room. We were informed that the room had not been used for some days and had been "sanitised". However on opening the door of the allocated room it was unacceptable. The hotel then found an alternative non smoking room on the Executive Floor for us. The food, cleanliness, and staff were all excellent; if there was a criticism it was that in room tea and coffee making facilities were at an extra charge, not usual for a 5* hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A real 5* experience”
Reviews.Author: dave1967
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Juan Carlos was the first leg of a three part holiday. We arrived at 8pm - quick taxi from the airport (about 20 euros) - and had an easy check-in. After unpacking we ventured outside to find a bar/cafe (which had to be suitable for a 5 year old). This was when we encountered our only gripe about the hotel - its location. There was nothing in terms of shops or restaurants in the vicinity. This is probably one of the reasons we got a pretty good deal on the hotel. The situation was partially helped by complimentary welcome cava cocktail, orange juice and a large plate of crisps. Everything about the hotel is 5*. The staff were excellent, the room amazing, even with the additional bed for my daughter and the 2 pools were very relaxing after a hard day's sight seeing. Prices are also 5* - if you are on a bit of a budget there is a petrol station round the corner, on Diagonal, where pastries, fruit juice etc can be bought to allow a quick, cheap and mobile breakfast. The Universtat Metro stop is about 200 metres from the hotel, on Diagonal, so it didn'y take long to get into town. If you don't know Barcelona, the metro is clean, quick, reliable and I found it to be very safe. Another bonus is that the bus touristic has a stop close to the next metro station down the line. Again, this is walkable from the hotel and saved standing in line for yonks in the centre of town waiting to catch a bus - you can buy tickets on the bus. On the last day we walked to Camp Nou, home of Barcelona FC (about 15 minute walk). I thoroughly enjoyed the tour and started to get a real feel for the importance of the club in Catalonia, both socially and politically. I already liked the club - I was further converted. The bonus each night was that the hotel environs were very quiet (being out of town) and the rooms well sound proofed so we all had a good sleep. All in all this was areal 5* experiance for the price of a 3* in the centre of town. It would have been nice to have a coffee making facility in the room and my advice woul dbe to remember taht unless you are especially 'minted' prepare to travel into the town centre to eat. Enjoy

Reviews.Title: “Very grand, if showing its age”
Reviews.Author: Trebuchet
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Rey Juan Carlos as part of a conference package. It's a two minute walk across some pleasant gardens to the conference centre, but a ten minute tube ride into the centre of town. It's certainly a very visually impressive hotel when you go through the main door, the elevators and balconies loom over you as this is an 'atrium' hotel with all the rooms opening out onto balconies that look down on the lobby. Even from the seventh floor it's a pretty vertiginous sight looking down, but not quite as dizzying as the prices for the mini bar, or even for the drinks at the hotel bar. I spoke to one chap that ate a kit kat before he realised it was seven euros, then I paid twenty three euros for three beers at the bar. The hotel was built in time for the 1992 Olympics, and was undoubtedly fantastic at the time. It's showing its age a bit, for example the shower head was a bit wonky and the bath didn't work very well, but those are pretty minor gripes. As I wasn't paying for the room I wouldn't be able to say whether it was good value, but it was certainly well appointed and the staff are very good.

Reviews.Title: “Impressive Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Peroni_Lad
Reviews.Content: I was attending a conference so the hotel was booked as part of a conference package direct with the conference organisers. A few of my colleagues stayed in other hotels but said the Rey was a superior hotel to theirs. As a conference centre the venue is very good as the food and drink was available when it should have and the service was of a high standard in my opinion. The staff that I spoke with all had a good command of English and I had no problems communicating. The central area on the ground floor has a wonderful view of the hotel high rise room architecture and the ground floor has a buzz about the place when people are scurrying around which I found pleasant. The waiter service was excellent and every time I sat in this area I was asked if I wanted a coffee or other drink which was brought to me quickly and with good manner. Breakfast was impressive and an extensive selection was available. The room I had was bigger than the usual corporate style rooms I have stayed in over the years and was kept spotlessly clean by the maids. Bar prices were pretty high but this was to be expected. The hotel is not really well placed for City tourists and is a way out of town. Best suited for conference people or visiting VIPs looking for an overnight stay and I would not go back for a holiday - to be honest though the price would also be a factor for me personally.

Reviews.Title: “Good for Business”
Reviews.Author: choup91
Reviews.Content: The Rey Juan Carlos is a good place to organize Business Event. Just next door you have the PALAU DE CONGRESSO, which give you the opportunity to organize everything : auditorium, exhibition, meetings, cocktails... The hotel itself is ok, rooms a quiet small when you are sharing it with someone, (single room I don't test it) People at the front speak easily English, it's not well placed for Shopping, but just ask for a taxi and you'll be in the town in 10 minutes (depending of traffic jam) If you have the chance, try to go at the ELEFANT night Club (around 20 minutes walking distance from the RJC), it's really nice and well known night club

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for business, probably best avoided for a holiday”
Reviews.Author: NautiusMaximus
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for a few days for a conference. I went there with some trepidation having read the less than glowing reviews on this site, but really it wasn't that bad. The hotel is certainly not perfect, but on the whole I felt it deserved its 5 stars. The rooms were comfortable enough, and a good size. The staff were helpful and numerous. The conference facilities were excellent. As conference delegates, using the on-site conference facilities, we were very well looked after. I don't think I once had to queue to get a coffee during coffee breaks. When I had a problem with the AV equipment while I was giving a talk, it took very little time to find one of the tech support guys, who fixed the problem very quickly. So what of the criticisms that other users have made? Well, a couple of people commented on the lack of English language skills of some of the staff. I suspect they have unrealistic expectations. The front desk staff had absolutely fluent English, and while I'm sure not all the staff did, let's face it, the hotel is in Spain. I'll bet the price of a week's stay in this hotel that the average standard of English here is far better than the average standard of Spanish in any hotel in London. If you have language problems here, then frankly you're not even making an effort. One user commented on the lack of storage space in the bedrooms. Those criticisms are partly justified, partly not. It's true that there is no shelf under the sink in the bathroom for one's belongings, but there is almost certainly more room than you need on the surfaces around the sink to put anything you could possibly have brought with you, unless you've gone there with an entire pharmacy. However, there was rather minimal space in the rest of the bedroom in cupboards and drawers. I would have liked a draw or cupboard next to the bed, but there wasn't one. I had just about enough space to put away everything I brought with me, but if you're staying there for a week or more or just have never mastered the art of travelling light, then you may not. The criticism of the design causing the door between the bedroom and the corridor to get in the way of the wardrobes is spot on. It was a complete pain. Literally, in fact, as at one stage I caught my finger between the door to the room and the door to the wardrobe. If I were American, I'd probably sue them for it. Other people have criticised the air conditioning. It was actually just about OK for me, but I did have it turned up to max at the end of April and was certainly not too cold. I suspect it could be a problem if you're there in the summer. One complaint about this hotel, mentioned by other reviewers, which is entirely justified is the price. The room rate itself was actually perfectly reasonable by 5-star standards (although it was a special rate negotiated for our conference, so it may not always be so), but they really screwed you for all the extras. I am probably less price-sensitive than most people when it comes to things like grabbing a bottle of water from hotel mini-bars, but even I took one look at the prices and immediately went for a little walk to try to find somewhere else to buy a bottle of water (head towards the university campus, turn left off the Diagonal at the metro station, and go along the road in front of the big official palace-looking building to get to the shops). I think €5 for a small bottle of mineral water is a new record in my experience. Other things were like that too: internet access, room service, drinks in the bar, laundary: you name it, they overcharged for it. Some of my colleagues were particularly annoyed that they wouldn't provide you with an iron, so if you turned up with a crumpled shirt then you had to pay their outrageous laundary prices if you wanted it pressed. If you have a travel iron, make sure you pack it. Anyway, despite all that, I thoroughly enjoyed my time there. The conference was great, and everyone at the hotel seemed to do their best to make sure that it was. The hotel has a lovely garden, which is a great place for relaxing in. However, one other drawback of this hotel, which would be particularly annoying if you are there for fun rather than work, is the location. It is in the middle of nowhere, and if you want to see any of the interesting bits of Barcelona (apart from the Cervantes rose garden, which is more or less just opposite the hotel, and absolutely stunning), then you need to spend the best part of half an hour in a metro or taxi to get there. For that reason, if I go back to Barcelona for a holiday, it is extremely unlikely I'll stay there again. But if you're considering going there for a conference, then go for it!

Reviews.Title: “luxury hotel for pleasure”
Reviews.Author: andreaspas
Reviews.Content: excellent servise, nice spa area, wonderfull view, expencive, 5 min from metro, away from the center,clean

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel but with flaws”
Reviews.Author: Cooki
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights while attending a convention in the nearby Pallau de Conressos which is some 15-20 minutes taxi ride from Las Ramblas. Few positive things : Professional, helpful staff, luxurious in many aspects, nice big atrium lobby area. Nice fitness centre, recreational facilites like Tennis etc, a nice spa on site. Even a Golf course not too far away. Decent sized room, tastefully decorated. Bathroom nicely equipped. Few negative things now : First of all it can get very expensive! Room service menu items are 30-40 euros per dish, internet costs EUR 40 per day which is not very fast. Shower cubicle nice but mine had a rusty ceiling. Bath tub has a shower but does not have glass/curtain to prevent water from sprinkling on the floor. No ironing board and no LCD/plasma.Mini-bar quite small and inefficient in cooling. No coffee/tea making facility. Mattress a little too hard, small pillows. These are all not there in the standard room, I am sure it is better in the deluxe rooms but overall makes you question the criteria by which this hotel was added as being one of "The Leading Hotels of the World". Overall, definitely worth it if you are in Barcelona to attend a convention at the Pallau de Congressos as it is literally 3 minutes walk but avoid otherwise.

Reviews.Title: “Over-rated, Expensive, Bland”
Reviews.Author: Vic_Vivant
Reviews.Content: The Rey Juan is supposedly a 5-star resort , yet over the 3 days in resident for a conference, I found the service, amentieis and certainly the food more like that of a 3-star hotel - all for the price of one of the more expensive 5-star hotels. In fact, the in-room service charges were some of the most outrageous experienced - ever. And, I've been privilaged to stay at some fairly luxurious places. Because the hotel sits in what appears to be more industrial area, once at the hotel you fell imprisioned as there is NOTHING to do or see within walking distance. A 10-15 min taxi or a ride on the underground is required to get within walking distance of the town centre. English was found to be fluent with desk staff, but no so much with the serving staff. While not usually an issue, it did take about an 40 minutes to find someone who could understand that I wanted hot water for my tea, and not cold.

Reviews.Title: “Many amenities but some business and design challenges”
Reviews.Author: Marge246
Reviews.Content: This review is written from the perspective of a business traveler on a stay of several nights, attending a meeting in the hotel. The five star rating makes sense from the perspective of hotel amenities - high end bathroom, excellent bed, full service, flat screen TV, etc. From an international business perspective, the five stars make a little less sense. The hotel was full of people from all over Europe, the U.S. and the Persian Gulf, but very few staff had enough English to interpret any but the most basic requests. When on vacation, it's my job to know the host hotel's first language. When traveling on business in a luxury business hotel, it's their job to have enough English to accomodate international travelers. This was particularly frustrating when speaking to the hotel operator on the phone - e.g. I asked for an electrical adaptor and the response was "what time do you want the wake up call?" The concierge and front desk staff had very good English, so there was always a recourse - but it often involved going down to the desk. (The adaptor episode led to a very drawn out adventure where I was certain the housekeeping staffer would start a fire - in her zeal to be helpful, she was attaching several appliances with incompatible voltages together, and I had to use body language and some high school theater background to register my increasing alarm). The staff was universally friendly and eager to please; sincere intention to take care of guests was ever-present. Wireless did not work in my guest room but worked very well in the lobby. Wired internet access in the guest room is 20 Euros - that's 30 bucks for you Americans, and reinforces my irritation that higher-end hotels love nickle and diming us to death. From a design perspective, I give the hotel mixed reviews. Strengths included an easy to navigate hotel footprint, attractive modern design, the incredible mattress - I had no back pain for the entire stay, and others in my group had similar feedback; linens and pillows were abundant and very high quality. Plenty of work and sitting space, tons of closet space. Weaknesses - will someone shoot these designers for me, please? I think half the people who design hotel rooms never actually sleep in one. The odd sweeping diagonal of the entrance to the sleeping room meant that you must have the door to your sleeping area closed in order to fetch your clothes - this caused endless awkward reaches for things in the closet. But the most senseless was the bathroom. Beautiful granite finishes - but the counter space was minimal and piled with signs and amenities - with no shelf space underneath for the guest's actual belongings. This is one of my pet peeves. Where am I supposed to put my medications, hair stuff, lotions, potions? This is all more important to me than whatever soap or shampoo the hotel thinks I need. The shower design was actually dangerous - the tiny shower booth had a flimsy, aluminum-framed glass door which cracked when I pulled it shut. Despite two requests, nobody fixed it - and it could have shattered into the shower stall. But since the shower itself was so small you couldn't extend an arm in any direction, and since the only shelf space for toiltetries was 2 inches by 2 inches, I opted for the luxurious tub with shower attachment instead. The entrance to the toilet (also flimsy frame with glass) was less than 24 inches wide, so you had to be very careful entering it lest you incur a bruise or break the door - and there was also a bidet in there . . . taking up useful space. Re: temperature. The bellman helpfully told me that guests can only adjust the temperature 2 degrees on their own; any other adjustments must be managed by front desk, and the heat was blasting all over the building, even though it was quite temperate. (Our meeting room was exhaustingly overheated most of the time). Four phone calls and I was able to get the heat off in the sleeping room and get it cool enough to sleep in. The hotel has a very nice relaxed restaurant with a fine buffet breakfast that caters to many cultures. It did take a heroic act of intervention to get a cup of coffee and banana to carry away one morning when I was in a hurry. As a business hotel, it's important that guests can accomodate their meeting schedules with the ability to vittle themselves on their own. There is also no sundry shop on site, so tough luck if you forgot any key items. I didn't find the transportation a barrier - a 25 minute cab ride or metro ride downtown got me wherever I needed to go. A couple of other things I appreciated - an oversized hotel safe, big enough for computer, jewelery, money, shoes, a small pet . . . and a remarkably helpful concierge who gave me special advice about maintenance on the metro that saved my one day off to sightsee. All of the staff were quite wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Vertigo central”
Reviews.Author: KatAmsterdam
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel during November for an event. Staff service was not good. Only the reception staff spoke English well, other staff had considerable trouble understanding basic communication. We had an over priced lunch in the main foyer, costing upwards of 20 EUR for a very small sandwich and had to wait 30 mins to pay as there was no staff to be seen, only after going to reception was someone sent so we could pay. Service generally was slow but they did try hard. Rooms were comfortable but I did have a bed that squeaked every time I took a breath. Bathrooms were nicely fitted out though. The free spa is excellent, with steam rooms, aromatherapy steam sessions, sauna's, hydrotherapy pools etc. This is all free if you are staying at the hotel however, if you do not bring your slippers from the room you have to pay 2 EUR for flip flops and if you want to use the indoor pool its 5 EUR to purchase a swimming cap. Note of caution the spa area is separated male/female so be aware once you enter with your partner you will not see them again except in the indoor pool area. I met a lady who was with her husband and they had not realized so she was sitting all alone in the hot tub looking a bit lost. Not the romantic spa weekend away that they had planned. They also have a good fitness area, massage and treatments, salon and a range of classes such as dance and yoga for an extra fee. If you suffer from vertigo (afraid of heights) then ask for a lower level room. There are 4 lifts 2 of which are glass and run the full height of the hotel. Rooms open out onto walkways that look down into the main foyer. The Garden restaurant was very nice, not too expensive and the food was great. A good setting for a romantic dinner. They have some original Gaudi chairs in the foyer and the building looks impressive. It's by no means in the center of Barcelona so you will either need a taxi to get in or walk to the nearest tram or metro.

Reviews.Title: “It's a long walk!!”
Reviews.Author: SB1Epworth
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Juan Carlos for 3 nights and at first marvelled at the sight of a very large, imposing hotel. The lobby area is vast and the ceiling extends to the top of the hotel with the rooms surrounding the area creating a vast cavern with spectactular views of the lobby from the glass elevators. The room we had on the 6th floor was very comfortable with views to the rear of the hotel over the David Lloyd tennis club. There are a few things to take into account however: 1. Room facilities - there are no tea or coffee making facilities in the room nor can you ask for an iron or ironing board. 2. Everything is chargeable so morning tea or coffee has to be ordered from room service and housekeeping will charge you 7 euros to iron your shirt. 3. Breakfast in the restaurant is about 26 euros each! On the plus side checking in and out was very efficient and speedy and the English speaking concierges are extremely good. Be prepared though - this isn't the hotel for you if you want to step out of the door and into Las Ramblas. Whilst taxis are cheap compared to London and the nearby Metro is cheap and clean everything is a ride away. 15 minutes by Metro to the old town and, depending on traffic, about 25 minutes by taxi. The only thing nearby is the Nou Camp Stadium which is a 15 minute walk and very well worth it!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for conferences”
Reviews.Author: oyvindsolstad
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Rey Juan Carlos I for a conference. The service is excellent: Friendly (and lots of) staff. The rooms are very clean, lots of towels, shampoos etc in the bathroom. Lots of hot water which stay the same temperature during your shower. The infosystem on the tv didn't work, but who uses that? Wireless everywhere, and ethernet plug in rooms. A bit slow, and too expensive: 20 Euros a day!! It really should be free on a hotel like this. Amazing lobby. Worth a visit alone. Nice conference rooms with good chairs. Funny that they send a maid to your room at about 18:00 in the afternoon to take of the cover on your bed!

Reviews.Title: “Worse after 1 year”
Reviews.Author: agro
Reviews.Content: Came back to the Juan Carlos after about a year, having had a positive stay in December 2005. I had to regret to notice several steps back in terms of quality and customer service. The room had the TV half-broken (it was hard to switch it on) the technician spoke little English and was not helpful. The reception was not attentive: my g/f left a shirt in the breakfast room - called the reception and said it was not found. Guyess what? The next day at the breakfast we asked the staff there and they said they found it. Again, we asked the reception if it was possible to have some shirt dry cleaned by the next day - they said it would not be possible because it wasd a weekend. We then calle the housekeeping and they said it was not a problem at all! I wonder why the guys and girils at the reception are so often so sloppy, not only at the Juan Carlos. It was a beautiful weekend in BArcelona, mid September, most guests wanted to use the outdoor swimming pool, but it was not possible because they were cleaning it: can you clean it on a Monday rather than on a weekend please? Last but not least, this hotel is really far from the centre, last year we enjoyed our stay so we didnt bother too much getting a cab, but this year we were really disappointed and we wished we had booked a hotel much cloer to the centre!

Reviews.Title: “LIKE STAYING AT A MARRIOTT IN DENVER”
Reviews.Author: garyfong1
Reviews.Content: This was rated as a five star hotel, and I was recommended by Amex Centurion Travel. When I got there, I was pretty shocked at the location - completely in the middle of a busy commercial district. Walking around the grounds all I could think of was, "City of Industry" The rooms were tourist class. Marble with tub, etc. but nothing special. Everybody outside of the front desk speaks only spanish (including in the spa) so be prepared for that. The airconditioning unit didn't work well, and the room was at 28c nearly the whole stay until the last day when they fixed it. The pool is small and rectangular, with neat recliner chairs in stainless steel submerged in the pool that blow bubbles through it. The spa was highly rated, but it was just average. Getting a massage service was very odd because the music was this crazy imitation disco music from the U.S. so just imagine trying to relax to a spanish version of YMCA playing at moderate volume, with a thick spanish accent.
